testcase.name: Multiple Roles (3)
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Basic

2)      Add a field named field1

3)      Add a field named field2

2.      Create an object of the GODefinition created in step1.

1)      externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record1, field1 = value1, field2 = a, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/1900

2)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record2, field1 = value2, field2 = a, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2000

3)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record3, field1 = value2, field2 = c, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2099

3.      Correct the definition of the GODefinition created in step1 with

1)      securedByRBP = Yes               

2)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

step.actions:
{C}1.      Create a role named RoleA

{C}1)      check view history permission for the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1

{C}2.      Add a rule

{C}1)      Access group = Everyone

{C}2)      Set TC = All

{C}3.      Create a role named RoleB

{C}1)      check correct permission for the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1

{C}4.      Add a rule

{C}1)      Access group = Everyone

{C}2)      Set TC = Restricted: field1 = value2

{C}5.      Create a role named RoleC

{C}1)      check delete permission for the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1

{C}6.      Add a rule

{C}1)      Access group = Everyone

{C}2)      Set TC = Restricted: field2 = a

{C}7.      Login in as a user

{C}8.      Go to MGO page

{C}9.      Search the object created in pre-condition step2

[Verify]

{C}                                     i.          The object can be searched out.

{C}10.   View the object searched out in step6

[Verify]

{C}                                    ii.          All three records show in the history tab.

{C}                                   iii.          Can view details of all three records by clicking them.

{C}                                   iv.          Can see “Make Correction” link on Record2 and Record3

                                                       iv.        Can see “Permanent Delete” links on Record1 and Record2.

{C}11.   Make correction to externalName of Record2

{C}12.   Save and check DB

[Verify]

{C}                                    v.          ExternalName value of Record2 has been changed in DB.

SQL:

select * from sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t where object_type = '<GODefinition external_code>' and external_code = '<object external_code>'

{C}17.   Delete Record1

{C}18.   Check DB

[Verify]

{C}                                    x.          No Record1 in DB.

SQL: Same as above.

testcase.name: Association in Parent's field override (multiple role/rule)
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object, Foundation Object in Provisioning
2.       Create an object definition PLT12899Comp1ChildDef
1)      Field1, field2, field3, field4
3.       Create an object definition PLT12899Comp2ChildDef
4.       Create an object definition PLT12899Comp3ChildDef
5.       Create an object definition PLT12899Comp4ChildDef
6.       Create an object definition PLT12899VWChildDef
7.       Create 2 object instances of PLT12899VWChildDef
1)      externalCode = VW1
2)      externalCode = VW2
8.       Create an object definition PLT12899RootDef
1)      Association: name = CompAsso1; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT12899Comp1ChildDef
2)      Association: name = CompAsso2; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12899Comp2ChildDef
3)      Association: name = CompAsso3; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12899Comp3ChildDef
4)      Association: name = CompAsso4; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12899Comp4ChildDef
5)      Association: name = VWAsso1; type = valid when; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT12899VWChildDef
6)      Association: name = VWAsso2; type = valid when; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12899VWChildDef
7)      Association: name = VWAsso3; type = valid when; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12899VWChildDef
8)      Association: name = VWAsso4; type = valid when; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12899VWChildDef
9.       Create object instances for PLT12899RootDef
1)      Root1
a.CompAsso1: Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2
b.CompAsso2: Asso2Child1
c.CompAsso3: Asso3Child1
d.CompAsso4: Asso4Child1
e.VWAsso1: VW1, VW2
f. VWAsso2: VW1
g.VWAsso3: VW1
h.VWAsso4: VW1
2)      Root2
a.CompAsso1: Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2
b.CompAsso2: Asso2Child2
c.CompAsso3: Asso3Child2
d.CompAsso4: Asso4Child2
e.VWAsso1: VW1, VW2
f. VWAsso2: VW1
g.VWAsso3: VW1
h.VWAsso4: VW1
10.   Update definition PLT12899RootDef
1)      Security: Secured = Yes; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
2)      Association CompAsso3: visibility = read only
3)      Association CompAsso4: visibility = not visible
4)      Association VWAsso3: visibility = read only
5)      Association VWAsso4: visibility = not visible
11.   Create a RBP role: PLT12899Role1
1)      Check permission: View and Edit of PLT12899RootDef
2)      Field override settings
a.CompAsso1: read only
b.CompAsso2: no access
c.CompAsso3 read only
d.VWAsso1: read only
e.VWAsso2: no access
f. VWAsso3: read only
3)      Rule
a.Access group: mhoff, cgrant, admin
b.Target criteria: all
12.   Create a RBP role: PLT12899Role2
1)      Check permission: View and Edit of PLT12899RootDef
2)      Field override settings
a.CompAsso1: no access
b.CompAsso2: read only
c.CompAsso3 no access
d.VWAsso1: no access
e.VWAsso2: read only
f. VWAsso3: no access
3)      Rule
a.Access group: jlo, admin
b.Target criteria: all
13.   Create a RBP role: PLT12899Role3
1)      Check permission: View and Edit of PLT12899RootDef
2)      Rule
a.Access group: mhoff
b.Target criteria: externalCode = Root1
14.   Create an object definition: PLT12899Unrelated
1)      Security: Secured = Yes; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
15.   Create a RBP role: PLT12899Unrelated
1)      Check permission: View and Edit of PLT12899Unrelated
2)      Rule
a.Access group: everyone
b.Target criteria: All

testcase.name: User in access group of both roles has OR logic override permissions ‘No access’ to objects(3)
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

{C}1)      effectiveDating = None

{C}2)      Add a field: label = field1

{C}3)      Add another field: label = field2

{C}2.      Create an object of the GODefinition created in step1

{C}3.      Correct GODefinition created in step1

{C}1)      securedByRBP = Yes

{C}2)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

step.actions:
1.      Create a role name RoleA

{C}1)      UserA is in the access group

{C}2)      Check edit permission of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1

{C}3)      Add a field override permission for GODefinition created in pre-condition step1: field1 = No Access.

{C}2.      Create a role name RoleB

{C}1)      UserA is in the access group

{C}2)      Check edit permission of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1

{C}3.      Login  as UserA

{C}4.      Go to MGO page

{C}5.      Search and view the object created in pre-condition step2

[Verify]

{C}                 i.          All fields of the object can be viewed.

{C}6.      Edit the object created in pre-condition step2

[Verify]

{C}                ii.          All fields can be viewed and edited.

testcase.name: Field override 'read only' affect create operation.
testcase.preconditions:
{C}1.      Create a GODefinition with

{C}1)      effectiveDating = None

{C}2)      Add fields with all primitive dataType and GO/PickList/FO

{C}3)      securedByRBP = Yes

{C}4)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

{C}2.      Create a role

{C}1)      check edit permission for the GODefinition created in step1

{C}2)      Set fields of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1.2 with “Read Only” override permission.

step.actions:
Login as a user who is in access group of the role created in pre-condition step2.

Go to MGO page

Create an object of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1.
step.expectedresults: Read Only field are not available for create.

testcase.name: Field override 'no access' affect create operation
testcase.preconditions:
{C}1.      Create a GODefinition with

{C}1)      effectiveDating = None

{C}2)      Add fields with all primitive dataType and GO/PickList/FO

{C}3)      securedByRBP = Yes

{C}4)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

{C}2.      Create a role

{C}1)      check edit permission for the GODefinition created in step1

{C}2)      Set fields of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1.2 with “No Access” override permission.

step.actions:
Login as a user who is in access group of the role created in pre-condition step2.
 
Go to MGO page
 
Create an object of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1.
step.expectedresults: No Access fields of the object are not visible and editable.

testcase.name: Have correct permission, no override, “Read Only” in definitioncan view but can’t correct.
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

{C}1)      effectiveDating = Basic

{C}2)      Add a field: label = field1 and visibility = Read Only

{C}3.      Create an object for  the GODefinitions created in step1.

{C}4.      Correct the definitions of the GODefinitions created in step1 with

{C}1)      securedByRBP = Yes

{C}2)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

step.actions:
1.      Create a role

{C}1)      check correct permission for the GODefinition created in step1

{C}2.      Login as a user who is in access group of the role created in step1.

{C}3.      Go to MGO page

4.      Correct the objects of the GODefinitions created in pre-condition step3.
step.expectedresults:
All the fields of the object can be viewed.
 
All the fields of the object can corrected, except for field1.

testcase.name: Have correct permission, can’t correct or view the field with “No Access” override permission.
testcase.preconditions:
{C}1.      Create a GODefinition with

{C}1)      effectiveDating = Basic

{C}2)      Add a field named field1 with dataType = FO

{C}2.      Create an object for both of the GODefinitions created in step1.

{C}3.      Correct the definitions of the GODefinitions created in step1 with

{C}1)      securedByRBP = Yes               

{C}2)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

4. Create a role
 
1) check correct permission for the GODefinition created in step1
 
2) Set field1 of the GODefinitions created in pre-condition step1-2 with “No Access” override permission.

step.actions:
1. Login as a user who is in access group of the role created in step1.
2. Go to MGO page
3. Correct the objects of the GODefinitions created in pre-condition step3.
4. Make correction to externalName.
5. Save and check DB
SQL:
 
select sf_field1 from sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t where object_type = '<GODefinition external_code>' and external_code = '<object external_code>' and effective_start_date = ‘<effectiveStartDate of the record>’
step.expectedresults:
1. All the fields of the object can be viewed and corrected, except for field1.

2. Value of field1 in DB is the same as before editing.

testcase.name: User in access group of both rules has OR logic override permissions read only to objects
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

{C}1)      effectiveDating = None

{C}2)      Add a field: label = field1

{C}2.      Create two objects of the GODefinition created in step1: ObjectA and ObjectB.

{C}3.      Correct GODefinition created in step1

{C}1)      securedByRBP = Yes

{C}2)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

1.      Create a GODefinition with

 

{C}1)      effectiveDating = None

{C}2)      Add a field: label = field1

{C}2.      Create two objects of the GODefinition created in step1: ObjectA and ObjectB.

{C}3.      Correct GODefinition created in step1

{C}1)      securedByRBP = Yes

{C}2)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

4. Create a role
 
1) Check edit permission of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1
 
2) Add a field override permission for GODefinition created in pre-condition step1: field1 = Read Only.
 
3) Add a rule(RuleA)
 
a.      UserA is in access group
 
b.      Set a TC: externalCode = ObjectA
 
4) Add a rule(RuleB)
 
a.      UserA is in access group
 
}b.      Set a TC: externalCode = ObjectB

step.actions:
1.      Login  as UserA
 
2.      Go to MGO page
 
3.   Edit the objects created in pre-condition step2
step.expectedresults:
i.          All fields of the ObjectA can be viewed.
 
ii.          All fields of the ObjectB can be viewed.
 
iii.          All fields of the ObjectA can be edited, except for field1.
 
iv.          All fields of the ObjectB can be edited, except for field1.

testcase.name: Field override of different dataType.
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

{C}1)      effectiveDating = None

{C}2)      add a field named StringReadOnly with dataType = String

{C}3)      add a field named StringNoAccess with dataType =String

{C}4)      add a field named NumberReadOnly with dataType = Number

{C}5)      add a field named NumberNoAccess with dataType =Number

{C}6)      add a field named DecimalReadOnly with dataType = Decimal

{C}7)      add a field named DecimalNoAccess with dataType =Decimal

{C}8)      add a field named BooleanReadOnly with dataType = Boolean

{C}9)      add a field named BooleanNoAccess with dataType =Boolean

{C}10)   add a field named DateReadOnly with dataType = Date

{C}11)   add a field named DateNoAccess with dataType =Date

{C}12)   add a field named PicklistReadOnly with dataType = Picklist

{C}13)   add a field named PicklistNoAccess with dataType =Picklist

{C}14)   add a field named TranslatableReadOnly with dataType = Translatable

{C}15)   add a field named TranslatableNoAccess with dataType =Translatable

{C}16)   add a field named GOReadOnly with dataType = GO

{C}17)   add a field named GONoAccess with dataType =GO

{C}18)   add a field named FOReadOnly with dataType = FO

{C}19)   add a field named FONoAccess with dataType =FO

20)   add a field named EnumReadOnly with dataType = Enum

 

21)   add a field named EnumNoAccess with dataType = Enum

{C}22)   {C}add a field named UserReadOnly with dataType = User

{C}23)   add a field named UserNoAccess with dataType =User

{C}2.      Create an object of the GODefinition created in step1.

{C}3.      Update definition of the GODefinition created in step1

{C}1)      securedByRBP = Yes

{C}2)      permissionCategory = “Micellaneous Permissions”

step.actions:
1.      Create a role

1)      Check edit permission for the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1.

2)      Add a field override permission: StringReadOnly = Read Only

3)      Add a field override permission: StringNoAccess = No Access

4)      Add a field override permission: NumberReadOnly = Read Only

5)      Add a field override permission: NumberNoAccess = No Access

6)      Add a field override permission: DecimalReadOnly = Read Only

7)      Add a field override permission: DecimalNoAccess = No Access

8)      Add a field override permission: BooleanReadOnly = Read Only

9)      Add a field override permission: BooleanNoAccess = No Access

10)   Add a field override permission: DateReadOnly = Read Only

11)   Add a field override permission: DateNoAccess = No Access

12)   Add a field override permission: PicklistReadOnly = Read Only

13)   Add a field override permission: PicklistNoAccess = No Access

14)   Add a field override permission: TranslatableReadOnly = Read Only

15)   Add a field override permission: TranslatableNoAccess = No Access

16)   Add a field override permission: EnumReadOnly = Read Only

 

17)   Add a field override permission: EnumNoAccess = No Access

18)   Add a field override permission: GOReadOnly = Read Only

19)   Add a field override permission: GONoAccess = No Access

20)   Add a field override permission: FOReadOnly = Read Only

21)   Add a field override permission: FONoAccess = No Access

22)   Add a field override permission: UserReadOnly = Read Only

23)   Add a field override permission: UserNoAccess = No Access

2.      GO to MGO page

3.      View the object created in pre-condition step2

[Verify]

                                     i.          All fields can be viewed, except for those with “No Access” field override.

4.      Edit the object

[Verify]

                                    ii.          All fields can be viewed, except for those with “No Access” field override.

                                   iii.          All fields are editable, except for those with “Read Only” field override.

testcase.name: To verify field override 'no access' can be set on default field value
testcase.summary: To verify field override can be set to ‘Read-only’ or ‘No Access’ on default value field, if the field is non-required
testcase.preconditions:
• Login to application and go to Configure Object Definition
  • Create New ->Object Definition and enter code as 'cust_Obj_DefVal'
  • Change the effective dating to BASIC
  • Add new field 'cust_Test1' with String datatype and click on details link and enter Default Value as 'Release1511'
  • Select RBP as Yes, folder as Miscenelleous
  • Save the object definition
  • Go to Manage Permission Roles -> Permission-> Miscelleneous Folder
  • For the object 'cust_Obj_DefVal' ,select the check boxes for create ,insert,correct & delete
  • Select the check box for 'FieldOverride'
  • Select cust_Test1 and Not visible No Access
  • Save the permission

step.actions:
• Go to Manage data page and click on Create New ->cust_Obj_DefVal
  • Enter the externalcode & name
  • Observe the field 'cust_Test1'
step.expectedresults: The field should not be visible

step.actions:
• Save the above object
  • Click on Take Action->Make correction and observe the field 'Test1'
step.expectedresults: The field should not visible

step.actions:
• Click on Insert New Record, select any past date
  • Observe the field 'Test1'
step.expectedresults: The field should not visible

step.actions:
• Click on Insert New Record, select any future date
  • Observe the field 'Test1'
step.expectedresults: The field should not visible

testcase.name: To verify field override 'Read only' can be set on default field value
testcase.summary: To verify field override can be set to ‘Read-only’ or ‘No Access’ on default value field, if the field is non-required
testcase.preconditions:
• Login to application and go to Configure Object Definition
  • Create New ->Object Definition and enter code as 'cust_Obj_DefVal'
  • Change the effective dating to BASIC
  • Add new field 'cust_Test1' with String datatype and click on details link and enter Default Value as 'Release1511'
  • Select RBP as Yes, folder as Miscenelleous
  • Save the object definition
  • Go to Manage Permission Roles -> Permission-> Miscelleneous Folder
  • For the object 'cust_Obj_DefVal' ,select the check boxes for create ,insert,correct & delete
  • Select the check box for 'FieldOverride'
  • Select cust_Test1 and Not visible Read only
  • Save the permission

step.actions:
• Go to Manage data page
  • Select cust_Obj_DefVal and select the object instance created in Step1
  • Observe the field 'Test1'
step.expectedresults: The field Test1 should be read only and should be populated with 'Release1511' value

step.actions: • Click on Create New ->cust_Obj_DefVal and observe the field 'Test1'
step.expectedresults: The field Test1 should be read only and must have value 'Release1511'

step.actions:
• Save the above object and click on Insert New record
  • Select any past date
  • Observe the field Test1
step.expectedresults: The field Test1 should be read only and must have value 'Release1511'

step.actions:
• Save the above object and click on Insert New record
  • Select any Future date
  • Observe the field Test1
step.expectedresults: The field Test1 should be read only and must have value 'Release1511'

testcase.name: Verify field override available for Quick Card
testcase.summary: Verify field override available for Quick Card

step.actions:
Create an object definition as "fieldOverride_GO".

Create an object definition as "fieldOverride_Root", set a Generic Object type custom field as "cust_go" with valid value source as "fieldOverride_GO".

Create an object instance of "fieldOverride_GO":

  externalCode = Go1

  externalName = Go1_Name

Create an object instance of "fieldOverride_Root":

  externalCode = Root

  cust_go = Go1.

Update the object definition of "fieldOverride_GO"

Set secured as Yes

Create a role for "fieldOverride_GO" and give all permission.

Add field override as:

externalCode = No Access

externalName = Read Only

grant this permission to everyone

Save this role
step.expectedresults: Role can be saved normally

step.actions: Proceed to Manage Data page and search Root of "fieldOverride_Root"
step.expectedresults: Object Root can be searched and opened normally

step.actions: Click "Edit" link in Quick Card "cust_go"
step.expectedresults:
Quick card can be opened normally.

externalCode cannot be seen in the quick card.

externalName cannot be updated in the quick card.

testcase.name: Insert record for object with TC through quick card
testcase.summary: Insert record for object with TC through quick card
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a basic GOdefinition InsertTCBasic
2. Create three instances for this GOdefinition 
Object1:
record1: externalName = notmeet   date = 01/01/2013
record2: externalName = meet      date = 01/01/2014
record3: externalName = notmeet   date = 01/01/2020
 
Object2:
record1: externalName = meet      date = 01/01/2020
record2: externalName = notmeet   date = 02/01/2020
 
3. Update the GOdefinition to Secured = Yes and Permission Category = Miscellaneous
 
4. Create two roles for definition InsertTCBasic 
1. Role InsertView:
1) "Permission"-->"Miscellaneous Permission"-->Check view history permission for definition InsertTCBasic 
2) Add a rule and select everyone in access group
3) save role
2. Role InsertWithTC:
1) "Permission"-->"Miscellaneous Permission"-->Check insert permission for definition InsertTCBasic  
2) Add a rule and select everyone in access group
3) Set TC externalName = meet
4) save role
 
5. Create a basic GOdefinition InsertTCINQC
Add a filed: BasicInTC, data type = GO, valida values recource = cust_InsertTCBasic
 
6. Create three object instances for InsertTCINQC
Root1:
date = 01/01/2020, BasicInTC = Object1
 
Root2:
date = 01/01/2020, BasicInTC = Object2

step.actions:
Go to manage GO page and search the objects created in pre-condition step6(as of date 01/01/2020)
[Verify]
i. All three objects can be searched out

Choose Root1 and click quick card for BasicInTC:
[Verify]
i. Can see Edit link in quick card
1) Click edit and enter with date 01/01/2012, exteranlName = insertName, also try with date =01/01/2019 and 01/01/2021
[Verify]
i. All can be edit successfully
ii. Click Manage link, can see all records inserted successfully
2) Edit with date = 02/01/2014, exteranlName = insertName 
[Verify]
iii. Can be edit successfully
iv. Reopen quick card again, cant see Edit link anymore

Choose Root2 and click quick card for BasicInTC:
[Verify]
i. Can see Edit link in quick card
1) Insert for recode2 with date = 01/02/2020, exteranlName = insertName, also try with date =02/02/2020
[Verify]
i. All can be edit successfully
ii. Click Manage link, can see all records inserted successfully
iii. Reopen quick card again, also can see Edit link 
2) Click edit and enter with date date = 01/01/2019, exteranlName = insertName 
[Verify]
i. Can be edit successfully
ii. Reopen quick card again, cant see Edit link any more

testcase.name: Verify the MGO page works normally of the object which has "<=" in the role
testcase.summary: Verify the search object funtion which has "<=" in the role

step.actions:
Preconditions:

1. Enable Generic Object

2. Enable Role-based Permission

Steps:

1. Create a GO difinition "PLT_MultiOperatorTest_MGO4" with a Number type: NumField, Decimal type:DecField,set Secured = Yes,Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions

2. Proceed to Manage Permission Role page and create a new role

3. Set Edit permission in permission settings->Miscellaneous Permissions for the GO object which created in step 1 and click done

5. Grant this permission to everyone without target criteria.

6. Create two object instance:

obj1: Number = 100, Decimal = 200.02;

obj2: Number = 200, Decimal = 400.02;

7. Edit the role for setting the target criteria.

8. Click "Add..." button to open the Grant Role page

9. Tick the redio of "Restric target population" and set the target criteria:

Set NumField <= 200, DecField <= 400.2

Grant this permission to cgrant.

6. Click Done of the Grant Role page.

7. Login as cgrant, proceed to MGO page and search the object of PLT_MultiOperatorTest_MGO4

[Verify]

(1) Both obj1 and obj2 can be searched out in the MGO page

8. Click the object name of obj2.

[Verify]

(1) All fields of obj1 displays normally

(2) Edit link displays in the right top of the object

8. Click the edit link name and edit the value of obj1:

Number = 99, Decimal = 400.03;

9. Search the object of PLT_MultiOperatorTest_MGO4 again

[Verify]

(1) Only obj1 can be searched in the MGO page

10. Login in admin, proceed to MGO page and search the object of PLT_MultiOperatorTest_MGO4

[Verify]

(1) No object can be searched out in the MGO page

11. Query the object data in DB

[Verify]

(1) obj1 and obj2 can be saved normally in the DB

(2) The updated value of obj1 can be saved normally in the DB

testcase.name: (None) User has permission for inactive user object based on RBP SubjectUserField
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a user-based GOdefinition

effectiveDating = None
externalCode = User
Add a User type field named 'cust_user1'; details: required and editable, includeInactiveUser

2. Create an object of the GODefinition1 created in step1.

externalCode = User1, cust_user1 = users_sys_id of UserA, externalName = UserA, field1 = value1, (UserA is active user and in UserF’s department, User1 is not in UserF's department)

externalCode = User2, cust_user1 = users_sys_id of UserB, externalName = UserB, field1 = value2, (UserB is inactive user and in UserF’s department, User2 is not in UserF's department)

externalCode = User3, cust_user1 = users_sys_id of UserC, externalName = UserC, field1 = value3,( UserC is inactive user and in UserF’s division, User3 is not in UserD’s division ).

externalCode = User4, cust_user1 = users_sys_id of UserD, externalName = UserD, field1 = value4,( UserD is active user and in UserF’s division, User4 is not in UserD’s division).

externalCode = User5, cust_user1 = users_sys_id of UserE, externalName = UserE, field1 = value4, (User5 is UserF’s department/division, UserE is not in UserF’s department nor division).

3. Update definition, Set securedByRBP = Yes; permissionCategory = “Miscellaneous Permissions”
Set RBP subjectUserField = 'cust_user1'


4. Create a role

Check edit permission of the GODefinition created in step1.
Add a rule:  access group = everyone, target population = Granted User’s Department.

5. Create a role

Check view permission of the GODefinition created in step1

Add a rule: access group = everyone, target population = Granted User’s Division.

step.actions:
Login as UserF
Go to MGO page and Search the objects of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step3
step.expectedresults:
UserA, UserB, UserC and UserD can be searched out.

UserE can't be searched out.

step.actions: View UserA and UserB
step.expectedresults:
Can show details of UserA/UserB.

The 'Take Action' link is visible:

Make Correction

Permanently Delete Entry

step.actions:
1. Open 'UserA' and click 'Make Correction'

2. Update cust_user = UserD and save

3. Search this object
step.expectedresults: The update change has been saved successfully.

step.actions:
Open object 'UserB' and clik 'Insert new record'

externalCode = User6, cust_user1 = users_sys_id of UserA, externalName = UserA, field1 = value1
step.expectedresults: The object UserA can be inserted successfully and displayed in the object list.

step.actions: Open object 'UserB' and click 'Permanetly Delete Entry'
step.expectedresults: The object 'User B' is deleted successfully and disappear from object list.

step.actions: View UserC and UserD
step.expectedresults:
Can show details of UserC/UserD.

But 'Take Action' link is not visible.

testcase.name: (Basic/MCPD) User has permission for inactive user object based on RBP SubjectUserField
testcase.preconditions:
1.Create a user-based GOdefinition

effectiveDating = Basic

externalCode = User

Add a User type field named 'cust_user1'; details: required and editable, includeInactiveUser=Yes


2. Create an object of the GODefinition1 created in step1.

externalCode = User1, cust_user1 = users_sys_id of UserA, externalName = UserA, effectiveStartDate=2014/02/01 (Less than today)(UserA is active user in UserD’s department)
Insert new record externalCode = User1, cust_user1 = users_sys_id of User B, externalName = UserB, effectiveStartDate = 2014/03/01(Less than today)(UserB is inactive user in UserF's department)


externalCode = User2, cust_user2 = users_sys_id of UserC, externalName = UserC, effectiveStartDate=2014/01/01(Less than today)( UserC is active user is in UserF’s division).
Insert new record externalCode = User2, cust_user2 = users_sys_id of UserD, externalName = UserD, effectiveStartDate=2014/12/01 (greater than today)(UserD is inactive user in UserF’s division)
Insert new record externalCode = User2, cust_user2 = users_sys_id of UserE, externalName = UserE, effectiveStartDate=2015/09/01(greater than today) (UserE is active user not in UserF’s department nor division)


externalCode = User3, cust_user3 = users_sys_id of UserE, externalName = UserE, effectiveStartDate=2014/05/01(greater than today)
Insert new record externalCode = User3, cust_user3 = users_sys_id of UserB, externalName = UserB, effectiveStartDate=2014/12/01(greater than today)

 

3. Update definition, Set securedByRBP = Yes; permissionCategory = “Miscellaneous Permissions”

Set RBP subjectUserField = 'cust_user1'


4. Create a role 'RoleA'

Check all permission of the GODefinition created in step1.

Add a rule: access group = everyone, target population = Granted User’s Department.

 
5. Create a role
 
Check view permission of the GODefinition created in step1
 
Add a rule: access group = everyone, target population = Granted User’s Division.

step.actions:
Login as UserF change the as of date as 08/09/2014(future date)
Go to MGO page and Search the objects of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step3
step.expectedresults:
object1 and object2 can be searched out.

object3 can't be searched out.

step.actions: View object1
step.expectedresults:
Two records are displaying correctly.

For record "UserB", the 'Take Action' link is visible:

Make Correction

Permanently Delete Entry

For record "UserA", no permission displayed

step.actions: 1. Open record 'UserA'
step.expectedresults: No permission show in history list and record cannot be opened

step.actions:
Open record 'UserB' and clik 'Insert new record'

Insert new record externalCode = User1, cust_user1 = users_sys_id of User B, externalName = UserB2, effectiveStartDate = 2015/03/01
step.expectedresults: The record UserB2 can be inserted successfully and displayed in the object list.

step.actions: Open record UserB2 and click 'Permanetly Delete Entry'
step.expectedresults: The record UserB2 has been deleted successfully and disappear from object list.

step.actions: View object2
step.expectedresults: No permission error pop up

step.actions:
object3 can't be searched out.

object3 has two records, record 1 is 'UserE' which is not in the target population, record 2 is 'UserB' which is in target population. Suppose user can view record 2 data, but because record 1 is valid based on effectiveStartDate(as of date), and user has no permission for record 1. So system selected to follow valid one's rule for all records.

 

This is new case for target user, we have no old behavior to follow. But for non-user based GO, its TC works as same behavior.

testcase.name: (Basic) User should have merged permissions if multiple roles defined for target Person(read only)
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create  a basic definition "cust_Person_GO5" 

    set externalCode as "Generic Object" （user）data type and valid values source "Person".

2. Enable RBP support: 

      1) Set secured = "Yes" and permission category = "Miscellaneous Permissions"

      2) set RBP Subject User Field = externalCode

3. Create two roles for "cust_Person_GO5" :

    Role1: grant all permissions without field override, access group = everyone, target population = User1;

    Role2: grant all permissions with Filed override: externalName = readonly, access group = everyone, target population = permission group including User1, User 2

step.actions:
1. create instance for "cust_Person_GO5".

    1) set externalCode = Person2. externalName = Person2_Name    

    note: person2 is mapped to User2.

2. search and view <Person2> instance.

3. Click take actions --> make corrections and verify externalName is non-editable.

4. Click Insert new record link and verify externalName is non-editable.

testcase.preconditions:

     <Person2>:

      <Person3>:

    2. Add permission rule: access group =  cgrant; target population = admin & cgrant

testcase.name: Insert a new record to the object of RBP GODefinition with workflow.
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Create a workflow named WF1 with
1)      Role: EM
2.       Create a GODefinition PLT7565 with
1)      effectiveDating = Basic
2)      StringField:  data type = String
3.       Create an object instance of PLT7565
1)      exteranlCode = Obj1
2)      effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2000
3)      StringField = String1
4.       Edit  GODefinition PLT7565 and set
1)      Workflow Routing = WF1
2)      pendingData = Yes
3)      securedByRBP = Yes
4)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions
5.       Create a role
1)      Check view history, and insert permission for PLT7565
2)      Select "Permission group" in access group and make sure userA is in this group and manager of userA is not
3)      Select “All” in TC section

step.actions:
1.       Login as userA
2.       Search the object created pre-condition step3.
3.       Insert a new record to the object.
4.       Click save button.
[Verify]
                     i.            A workflow confirmation pop-up shows.
5.       Click confirm button.
6.       Search the object in MGO page.
[Verify]
                   ii.            The object shows only one record entered in pre-condition step3.
7.       Login in as manager of userA
8.       Go to Employee FilesàGo to Pending Requests.
[Verify]
                  iii.            The workflow triggered in step4 shows under “Requests Waiting for My Approval”.
9.       Click the workflow
[Verify]
                 iv.            The page shows the changes the initiator made to the object created in pre-condition step3.
                   v.            Can see “Approve”, “Comment”, “Decline” buttons.
                 vi.            Can see the approver chain.
10.   Click Approve button.
11.   Login as userA
12.   Go to MGO page.
13.   Search the object created in pre-condition step3.
[Verify]
                vii.            The object shows two records, one created in pre-condition step3, another inserted in step3.
14.   Check DB
[Verify]
              viii.            There are two records in DB.             
SQL:
select * from <DB_schema>.generic_object_t where object_type = '<id of GO definition>' and external_code = '<external code of object>' ordered by effective_start_date.

testcase.name: Performance - Large position records, verify RBP function when only hierarchy RBP is created
testcase.preconditions:
1. Go to provisioning, choose test company instance, uncheck 'Enable Position Management', uncheck 'True position hierarchy', and check 'Succession management'.

2. Import large number of position data (e.g. around 100k) which has hierarchy setting under Admin user (please use attached csv to import data).

Also create another position which is not under Admin user's hierarchy, e.g. PositionA.

step.actions: Go to Configure Object Definition page, choose Position and set Secured as Yes, set Permission Category as Miscellaneous Permissions. Leave Create respects target criteria as No. Then save.

Go to Manage Permission Roles, create a new role. In 2 permission settings section, click Permission button. In left section, click Miscellaneous Permissions. Then go to right side, find out Position and check all access. Then click Done.

Go to section '3 Grant this role to', click Add button.
In opened page, select Everyone (All employees) in section '1: Define whom you want to grant this role permission to.'

In section '2: Specify the target population for the other objects', select 'Restrict target population to:'

Check the checkbox 'Include access to Position in the hierarchy below the Granted User's Position'.  Set to All level down, and uncheck 'Exclude access to Granted User's Position'. Then click Done button.

Click Save Changes button on role page.
step.expectedresults: Role should be saved without issue.

step.actions:
Go to Manage Data page. Select Position in Search field.

Click instance dropdown list arrow, and verify the returned instances.
step.expectedresults:
Only positions under logged-in user's hierarchy all level down should be shown. Others (e.g. positionA) should not be shown.

There should be no timeout error displayed.

step.actions: Select instance in different hierarchy level and verify the instance detail information.
step.expectedresults: Instance detail information should be displayed without issue.

testcase.name: Performance - Large position records, verify RBP when both hierarchy and normal TC RBP are created
testcase.preconditions:
1. Go to provisioning, choose test company instance, uncheck 'Enable Position Management', uncheck 'True position hierarchy', and check 'Succession management'.

2. Import large number of position data  (e.g. 100k) which has hierarchy setting under Admin user (please use attached csv to import data).

Also create another position (e.g. positionA) which is not under Admin user's hierarchy and its jobTitle is null.

Create another position (e.g. positionB) which is not under Admin user's hierarchy and its jobTitle is not null.

step.actions: Go to Configure Object Definition page, choose Position and set Secured as Yes, set Permission Category as Miscellaneous Permissions. Leave Create respects target criteria as No. Then save.

Go to Manage Permission Roles, create a new role A. In 2 permission settings section, click Permission button. In left section, click Miscellaneous Permissions. Then go to right side, find out Position and check all access. Then click Done.

Go to section '3 Grant this role to', click Add button.
In opened page, select Everyone (All employees) in section '1: Define whom you want to grant this role permission to.'

In section '2: Specify the target population for the other objects', select 'Restrict target population to:'

Check the checkbox 'Include access to Position in the hierarchy below the Granted User's Position'. Set to All level down, and uncheck 'Exclude access to Granted User's Position'. Then click Done button.

Click Save Changes button on role page.
step.expectedresults: Role A should be saved without issue.

step.actions: Create a new role B. In 2 permission settings section, click Permission button. In left section, click Miscellaneous Permissions. Then go to right side, find out Position and check all access. Then click Done.

Go to section '3 Grant this role to', click Add button.
In opened page, select Everyone (All employees) in section '1: Define whom you want to grant this role permission to.'

In section '2: Specify the target population for the other objects', select 'Restrict target population to:'

Check the checkbox 'Include access to Position with the following criteria'. Select 'JobTitle' and 'is not null' in following dropdown. Then click Done button.

Click Save Changes button on role page.
step.expectedresults: Role B should be saved without issue.

step.actions:
Go to Manage Data page. Select Position in Search field.

Click instance dropdown list arrow, and verify the returned instances.
step.expectedresults:
Positions under logged-in user's hierarchy all level down should be shown.

PositionB should also be shown.

PositionA should not be shown.

There should be no timeout error displayed.

step.actions: Select instance in different hierarchy level and position with jobTitle is not null separately and verify the instance detail information.
step.expectedresults: Instance detail information should be displayed without issue.

testcase.name: Loading RBP page with large number of objects with RBP enabled
testcase.summary:
XAF-15018

This will test on oracle and hana, enable new cache and disable new cache, read data from DB or cache.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Test on Oracle+enable new cache+from cache:

execute sql: insert into <schemal>.sys_config(sys_config_key,sys_config_type,sys_config_string_value) values('mdf_get_from_cache_enabled','mdf_rbp','true'); 

or update <schemal>.sys_config set sys_config_string_value = 'true' where sys_config_key = 'mdf_get_from_cache_enabled' and sys_config_type = 'mdf_rbp'

2. uncheck Disable New Cache for MDF DataModel [Not Ready for Sales/Production] on provisioning

3. clear cache

step.actions: Loading one role with 300+ secured GOD on qacand environment.
step.expectedresults: record loading page time, Request rbpPermissionRoleControllerProxy.getPermissionRole.dwr time, and getAllRBPObjectTypes time(this time from log)

step.actions: reload this role for 5 times
step.expectedresults: record those times for each reload.

step.actions:
execute sql:

update <schemal>.sys_config set sys_config_string_value = 'false' where sys_config_key = 'mdf_get_from_cache_enabled' and sys_config_type = 'mdf_rbp' and clear cache

(this is for 1. Test on Oracle+enable new cache+read data from DB)
repeat step1~step2

Do the same steps when check Disable New Cache for MDF DataModel [Not Ready for Sales/Production]  on provisioning and clear cache.

(This is for oracle + disable new cache, when disable new cache, this is no difference between read data from DB or from cache)
Do the same steps on HANA

testcase.name: Join by column association would not be supported by RBP

step.actions:
Login the home page and proceed to Configure Object Difinition page
 
 
 
Create two object definition as:
 
Child:  Code:JBCTest_Child, String type custom field "cust_parent_externalCode"
 
Parent:  Code:JBCTest_Root, set a join by column association "JBC", Multiplicity: One to Many, Destination Object: JBCTest_Child, Source Object Column = externalCode, Destination Object Column = cust_parent_externalCode.
step.expectedresults: Two object definition can be created normally

step.actions: Create an object instance with it's JoinByColumn association
step.expectedresults: Object instance can be created normally

step.actions: Update the both Root and Child object definition and set Security as Yes

Create a role and set Permission Settings:

In Permission settings, found the object of JBCTest_Root, tick the checkbox of Field level override

Check the list of Field in the Field level override
step.expectedresults: JoinByColumn association "JCB" cannot be found in the list

step.actions:
Grant all permission for JBCTest_Root and grant this role to everyone

Save this role
step.expectedresults: Role can be saved normally

step.actions: Return to Manage Data page and check the object of JBCTest_Root
step.expectedresults: Object can be viewed with JBC association section in the object

step.actions: Check the object list
step.expectedresults: User is not able to search the JBCTest_Child

step.actions:
Update the Role and grant the view permission of JBCTest_Child

Then return to Manage data page again

step.actions: Search the object of JBCTest_Child
step.expectedresults: Child object instance can be found

step.actions: Open the child object and check the content
step.expectedresults:
All fields and value displays normally

There is no correct link and user is not able to update this object

testcase.name: MDF object permission which is not granted in role would be cleaned when save a role

step.actions:
Create three object definitions and set secured as Yes:

1. PLT372513_None, effective date = None

2. PLT372513_Basic, effective date = Basic

3. PLT372513_Comp, effective date = From Parent

Create a role "cust_PLT372513" for this object and check all permission for PLT372513_None and PLT372513_Basic then grant this permission to everyone

For PLT372513_Comp, only tick field level override with externalName = No Access

Query DB to get the Role ID of  new created role with:

Select Role_ID from <DB Schema>.RBP_PERM_ROLE where role_name = 'cust_PLT372513';

Query DB to get internalId of object definitions which we create in step 1.
step.expectedresults: We can get the role Id and internalId

step.actions: Proceed to Manage Data page and search object instance for Object Permission Map with the Role Id we get in step 3
step.expectedresults: object can be searched out and opened

step.actions: Check the field and detail of fields in this object
step.expectedresults:
There are only two field with the internalId of cust_PLT372513_None and cust_PLT372513_Basic.

All related permissions are all marked as Yes

internalId of PLT372513_Comp cannot be found in the object

step.actions:
Update the role and remove the permission for PLT372513_None

Grant all permissions for PLT372513_Comp, Set field override externalName = No Access

Then save the role
Repeat step 5
step.expectedresults:
There are only two field with internalId of PLT372513_Basic and PLT372513_Comp.

All related permissions are marked as Yes

Field level override of PLT372513_Comp can be seen in the fieldOverrides section

internalId of PLT372513_None can not be found in the object

testcase.name: Verify field override behavior in MGO page for attachment type field
testcase.summary: Verify field override behavior in MGO page for attachment type field
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a Basic type GO definition:PLT13836 with three custom attachment type field: ATfield1,ATfield2 and ATfield3 and secured as Yes

2. Create a role for PLT13836: PLT13836Role1

  • Permission: View Current, View History
  • Field Level Override: ATfield3=No Access
  • Access Group:admin

3. Create a role for PLT13836: PLT13836Role2

  • Permission:Create, Correct, Delete
  • Field Level Override: ATfield2 = Read Only, ATfield3=No Access
  • Access Group:admin

Create the object instance as PLT13836Obj:

  • externalCode:PLT13836Obj
  • externalName: Root1
  • ATfield1=file1, ATfield2=file2, ATfield3=file3
  • Contant of file1 is 1, contant of file2 is 22, contant of file3 is 333.

step.expectedresults:
all fields include ATfield1, ATfield2 can be view in the object

ATfield3 is not existing.

testcase.name: (None) target user in RBP works on ConfigUI
testcase.preconditions:
1. Enable Generic Object in Provisioning

2. Create a child object definition PLT372299CompDef

3.1 Create an object definition PLT372299Def

1) externalCode: type = String;
2) cust_user1: type = User;
3) set subjectUserField = cust_user1
4) Association: One to Many; Composite;PLT372299CompDef

3.2 Create 2 objects for PLT372299Def

object1: externalCode = a1, externalName = User1record1,  cust_user1=user_sys_id of User1

object2: externalCode = a2, externalName = User2record1,  cust_user1=user_sys_id of User2

4. Create a Config UI

1)      Base object = PLT372299Def

2)      Id = PLT372299ConfigUI

 

5. Create a RBP role: PLT372299View

1)      Check view permission of PLT372299Def

2)      Access group = everyone

3)      Target group = permission group which includes user and user2

6.       Create a RBP role: PLT372299Edit

1)      Check edit permission of PLT37229Def

2)      Access group = permission group which includes admin

3)      Target group = permission group which includes user1

testcase.name: Not allow user to update record which doesn't meet TC by insert.
testcase.preconditions:
{C}1.      Create a GODefinition

{C}1)      effectiveDating = Basic

{C}2)      add a field named field1

{C}2.      Create an object of the GODefinition created in step1

{C}1)      externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record1, effectiveStartDate = 12/31/1997, field1 = value1.

{C}2)      Insert a new record: externalName = Record2, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2098, field1 = value2.

{C}3)      Insert a new record: externalName = Record3, effectiveStartDate = 12/01/2099, field1 = value3.

{C}3.      Update the definition of the GODefinition created in step1

{C}1)      securedByRBP = YES

{C}2)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

{C}4.      Create a permission group named GroupA which include only UserA.

{C}5.      Create a permission group named GroupB which exclude UserA but include UserB.

6.   Create a role

1）Click “Permission…”

2）Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

3）Check all permissions of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1.

4）Click done button.

5）Add a rule

6）Set access group = GroupA

7）Set TC: field1 = value1

8）Click done button.

9）Add another rule

10）Set access group = GroupB

11）Set TC = All

12）Click done button.

13）Click save changes button.

Login in as UserA.
 
Go to MGO page.
 
View the object created in pre-condition step2.

Click “Insert new record” link on Record1.
 
Set effectiveStartDate = 12/01/2099.
 
Change field1 value: field1 = value4.
 
Click save button.

step.actions:
Login in as UserB.
 
Go to MGO page.
 
View the object created in pre-condition step2.
step.expectedresults: Field1 value of Record3 is still value3.

testcase.preconditions:
1. Enable Generic Object

2. User permission:
admin: configure Object Definition, Manage Data and Read Write permission for object permissions are enabled

step.actions:
1. Create two object definition as below:
1). ID: cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_CompChild, effectiveDate=FromParent
2). ID: cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_VWChild, effectiveDate=None
3). ID: cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_GOField, effectiveDate=None

3. Create a FO type object with location "Shanghai".
4. Create Root object definition as:
1). ID: cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_Root, effectiveDate=None
2). Set up a one to many composite association "CompChild" and a one to many valid when association "VW Child" with the definition we created in step 1-1 and 1-2
3). Set up custome fields: cust_picklist, cust_go, cust_fo with the definition we created in step 1-3, 2 and 3.
4). Set up a user type field cust_user.
5). Set the visibility of mdfSystemStatus as Editable
5. Create object instances for all the object definition we created in step 1-2 and 1-3 as VW1(externalName = VW1_Name), VW2(externalName = VW2_Name), GO1(externalName = GO1_Name)

6. Create object instance for cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_Root as:
externalCode = Root1, externalName = Root1, cust_picklist = Option1, cust_go = GO1, cust_fo = Shanghai
CompChild = Comp1, Comp2
VWChild = VW1, VW2
7. Update the definition of cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_Root and set security = Yes, Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
8. Proceed to MGO page and search object instance of cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_Root
step.expectedresults: Nothing can be searched out

step.actions:
9. Create a role for the cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_Root and grant all permissions for it.
Grant role to everyone and set field for target criteria, click the drop down list of the operators:
1). cust_go
2). cust_fo
3). cust_picklist
4). cust_user
5). mdfSystemStatus
6). externalName
step.expectedresults:
"In" operator can be found in the drop down list for cust_go, cust_fo and cust_picklist,cust_user and mdfSystemStatus.
"In" operator cannot be found for externalName // can be found also.

step.actions:
10. Set association for target criteria, click the drop down list and check the operators:
1). VWChild
2). CompChild
step.expectedresults:
"In" operator can be found in the drop down list for VWChild(can be found）
CompChild cannot be select as target criteria.

step.actions: 11. Set the operator of cust_go, cust_fo, cust_picklist,mdfSystemStatus,cust_user, VWChild as "In" and move the cursor out of the input box
step.expectedresults:
"In" operator can be selected for all these fields/association.
Input box of the target criteria value turns to an auto-completion.
A new area displays for selected objects. No objects is selected in the area and the object count is 0.

Users in the list of auto-completion should displayed as the format: Fullname(Username), please ensure userId is not displayed

Error message displays in red under the selected objects area as "please provide a valid entry for: <field type>"

step.actions: 12. Click the auto-completion of cust_go target criteria
step.expectedresults: GO1 is displayed in the auto-completion as GO1_Name(GO1)

step.actions: 13. Select GO1 in the auto-completion
step.expectedresults: GO1 is displayed in the selected objects area and the object count turns to 1.

step.actions: 14. Click the ellipsis icon in selected objects area
step.expectedresults: A quick card shows with all selected objects (GO1)

step.actions: 15. Click the operator and set it from "in" to "="
step.expectedresults: Auto-completion and selected objects area disappear

step.actions: 16. Set the operator back to "In" and click the auto-completion of VWChild
step.expectedresults: VW1 and VW2 are displayed in the auto-completion

step.actions: 17. Select VW1 and VW2 in the auto-completion
step.expectedresults: VW1 and VW2 are selected and displayed in the selected objects area and the object count turns to 2.

step.actions: 18. Click the "x" button of VW1 in selected objects area
step.expectedresults: VW1 is removed from the selected objects area and the object count turns to 1.

step.actions: 19. Set target criteria as cust_fo In "Shanghai", cust_picklist In "Option1", externalName is not null and clist save button of the role
step.expectedresults: Role can be saved normally

step.actions: 20. Proceed to MGO page and search object instance of cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_Root
step.expectedresults: Root1 can be searched out

step.actions: 21. Update the role and update the target criteria of VWChild from only VW2 to both VW1 and VW2, then save the role again
step.expectedresults: Role can be saved normally

step.actions: 22. Proceed to MGO page and search object instance of cust_multiSelect_fieldCheck_Root
step.expectedresults: Root1 can be searched out

step.actions:
23. Check DB and query the value of the composite child of MDFTargetCriteriaDetail

select t1.external_code, t3.external_code,t3.sf_field1,t3.object_type, t2.sf_field4 from <schema>.generic_object_t t1, <schema>.generic_object_t t2,  <schema>.generic_object_t t3 where t2.parent_row_id = t1.row_id and t3.parent_row_id = t2.row_id and t1.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteria' and t1.sf_field1 =<internal id of root object definition> and t2.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaDetail' and t3.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaInValue';
step.expectedresults:
2 records for the composite child existing with selected object internalID as fields' value of the composite child

step.actions:
23. Check DB and query the value of the composite child of MDFTargetCriteriaDetail

SQL:

select rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, tc_map.row_id tc_map_row_id, tc.row_id tc_row_id, obj_def.external_code obj_def_external_code, tc.sf_field2 restriction, tc_detail.sf_field2, tc_detail.sf_field3, tc_detail.sf_field4
  from <DB Schema>.rbp_perm_role
  left join <DB Schema>.rbp_perm_rule on rbp_perm_role.role_id = rbp_perm_rule.role_id
  left join <DB Schema>.generic_object_t tc_map on tc_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_rule.rule_id)
  left join <DB Schema>.generic_object_t tc on tc.parent_row_id = tc_map.row_id
  left join <DB Schema>.generic_object_t tc_detail on tc_detail.parent_row_id = tc.row_id
  left join <DB Schema>.generic_object_t obj_def on tc.sf_field1 = obj_def.internal_id
  where role_name = '<role name>' and tc_map.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaMap'
  order by rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, obj_def.external_code, tc_detail.sf_field4 ;
step.expectedresults: Four record for the composite child existing with selected object internalID as fields' value of the composite child

testcase.name: View User permission should support IN and NOT IN for all field types

step.actions:
Create an Object definition as cust_PLT37629_GO

Create an Object definition as cust_PLT37629_VW

Create a Picklist as PLT37629_Picklist:

Code=option1, Name=option1_Name

Code=option2, Name=option2_Name

Create an Object definition cust_PLT37629_ROOT with custom fields as:

1. cust_go, type = Generic Object, valid value source= cust_PLT37629_GO

Set the Security = Yes

2. cust_fo, type= foundation, valid value source= location

3. cust_user, type = user

4. cust_picklist, type = picklist, valid value source = PLT37629_Picklist 

Set a Valid When association as VW1 with cust_PLT37629_VW

Set Security = Yes and click save button to create this object difinition

Update the difinition, set visibility of mdfSystemStatus as Editable

Create an FO instance for location:

1. externalCode=Shanghai, externalName=Shanghai_Name

2. externalCode=Beijing, externalName=Beijing_Name

Create two object instances for each object:

cust_PLT37629_GO:

1. externalCode=GO1, externalName=GO1_Name

2. externalCode=GO2, externalName=GO2_Name

cust_PLT37629_VW: 

1. externalCode=VW1, externalName=VW1_Name

2. externalCode=VW2, externalName=VW2_Name
Proceed to Manage Permission Roles page and create role

Grant View Permission for cust_PLT37629_ROOT

Grant this permission to admin

Set Target Criteria for all custom fields and mdfSystemStatus:

1. cust_go "in" GO1, GO2

2. cust_fo "in" Shanghai and Beijing

3. cust_user "in" cgrant1 and admin

4. cust_picklist "in" option1, option2

5. mdfSystemStatus "in" Active, InActive

6. VW1 "in" VW1, VW2

then save the role

Proceed to View User Permission page and search the permission for admin

Check the target criteria for the object cust_PLT37629_ROOT
step.expectedresults:
Target criteria for cust_PLT37629_ROOT displays as:

Target-criteria(cust_go IN [GO1_Name(GO1),GO12_Name(GO2)] AND cust_fo IN [Shanghai_Name(Shanghai),Beijing_Name(Beijing)] AND cust_user IN [Carla Grant(cgrant),Admin User(admin)] AND cust_Picklist IN [option1_Name(option1),option2_Name(option2)] AND mdfSystemStatus IN [Active,InActive] AND VW1 IN [VW1_Name(VW1),VW2_Name(VW2)])

step.actions: Repeat step 4~5 with set the operators from IN to NOT IN then check the Target Criteria in view user permission
step.expectedresults:
Target criteria for cust_PLT37629_ROOT displays as:

Target-criteria(cust_go NOT_IN [GO1_Name(GO1),GO12_Name(GO2)] AND cust_fo NOT_IN [Shanghai_Name(Shanghai),Beijing_Name(Beijing)] AND cust_user NOT_IN [Carla Grant(cgrant),Admin User(admin)] AND cust_Picklist NOT_IN [option1_Name(option1),option2_Name(option2)] AND mdfSystemStatus NOT_IN [Active,InActive] AND VW1 NOT_IN [VW1_Name(VW1),VW2_Name(VW2)])

step.actions:
Create another role for cust_PLT37629_ROOT

Grant this permission to admin

Set Target Criteria for cust_user and mdfSystemStatus:

1. cust_user = admin

2. cust_user != admin

3. cust_user IS NULL

4. cust_user IS NOT NULL

5. mdfSystemStatus = Active

6. mdfSystemStatus != InActive

7. mdfSystemStatus IS NULL

8. mdfSystemStatus IS NOT NULL

then save this role
step.expectedresults:
Input box of cust_user is autocompletion

Input box of mdfSystemStatus is drop down list

step.actions: Proceed to View User Permission and check the Target Criteria of the role created in step 7
step.expectedresults:
Target criteria for cust_PLT37629_ROOT displays as:

Target-criteria(cust_user_= [Admin User(Admin)] AND cust_user != [Admin User(Admin)] AND cust_user IS NULL AND cust_user IS NOT NULL AND mdfSystemStatus = [Active] AND mdfSystemStatus != [InActive] AND mdfSystemStatus IS NULL AND mdfSystemStatus IS NOT NULL)

step.expectedresults:

1) with 

2) With "Visibility"type and "Actions" type permissions.

testcase.name: Edit/Copy/Delete should work for a Person based GO permission Role
testcase.summary:
All Person related cases pls use EC cloned instance:

PLTAHUEC01/admin/pwd

1. Create a composite "cust_Person_C1":

     set externalCode as "Generic Object" type and valid values source "Person"

     add a cust_sf field as "Generic Object" type/ required / valid values source "Person"

2. Create a basic definition "cust_Person_P1":

     set externalCode as "Generic Object" type and valid values source "Person"

     add a cust_sf field as "Generic Object" type/ required / valid values source "Person"

     add 1:M "cust_comp" association with "cust_Person_C1".

3. Enable RBP support for both definition:

   1) "cust_Person_P1" :

    Secured: Yes

    Permission Category: Miscellaneous Permissions

    RBP Subject User Field: externalCode

   2) "cust_Person_C1": -- No need to do this, bahavior caused by CRF-1199

    Secured: Yes

    Permission Category: Miscellaneous Permissions

    RBP Subject User Field: externalCode

step.actions:
1. Navigate to "Manage Permission Role" :

    1) Click Create New

    2)  Fill in the Role Name "P_Role"

    3)  Click "Permission..."  -->  "Miscellaneous Permissions"

    4)  Check all permissions for "cust_Person_P1".

    5)  Click into "Grant this role to..."

         Grant role to: Everyone

         Target population: Everyone

     6) Click Done

     7) Click Save changes.
step.expectedresults: "P_Role" is created with valid permission and granting.

step.actions:
1. In Permission Role list, click Actions --> Take Actions dropdown --> Edit for "P_Role" created above.

2. Update Role Name to "P_Role_Updated";

    Update permissions for "cust_Person_P1" object: Add/Remove some permissions.

    Update target population  to a permission group which include admin.

3. Save changes.

4. Verify "P_Role_updated" on Persmission Role list and its details are updated as above.
step.expectedresults: "P_Role" is updated as expected.

step.actions:
1. In Permission Role list, click Actions --> Take Actions dropdown --> Copy for "P_Role_Updated" created above.

2. Set Name as "P_Role_Copied" and click Done;

3. Verify "P_Role_Copied" on Persmission Role list and its details are same as above.
step.expectedresults:
"P_Role_Updated" is copied with valid permissions.

No grant role

step.actions:
1. In Permission Role list, click Actions --> Take Actions dropdown --> Delete for "P_Role_Copied".

2. Verify "P_Role_Copied" is removed from Permission Role list.
step.expectedresults: "P_Role_Copied" is deleted.

testcase.name: Blocking settings should not show when person type field is defined as subject user

Given:
Object definition 'BasicPersonEntity' with:
  • EffectiveDating: Basic

  • Secured=Yes
  • Permission Category: Miscellaneous Permissions
  • RBP Subject User Field: personf
When:
Configure permission role for 'BasicPersonEntity':
  • For object permission: check all permissions
Then:
  • Will have '+' on the object definition on object permission page.
  • On grant rule page, only TP should show up for the entity. Blocking fields should not exist.

testcase.name: Can define TC on person type field value on permission role page
testcase.summary:
On permission role page, when god has person field but not set as subject user, then can define TC on person value.

The person value should be PERSON_ID_EXTERNAL (e.g. 'cgrant') instead of PERSON_ID(e.g. 21) 

Note: PERSON_ID_EXTERNAL and PERSON_ID are columns of table PER_PERSON

step.actions:
Given:

Object definition 'NonePersonEntity' with:
  • EffectiveDating: None
  • Field 'personf', DataType=Person, required = yes 
  • Secured=Yes
  • Permission Category: Miscellaneous Permissions

When:

Configure permission role for 'RBPPersonEntity':
  • For object permission: check all permissions

Then:

  • On grant rule page, user can only define TC for the god.
  • User can defined TC with person value.
  • Person value is value of PERSON_ID_EXTERNAL

testcase.name: UI - Verify the target population section when position is selected for a permission role

step.actions: Go to Configure Object Definition page, choose Position and set Secured as Yes, set Permission Category as Miscellaneous Permissions. Then save.

Go to Manage Permission Roles, create a new role. In 2 permission settings section, click Permission button. In left section, click Miscellaneous Permissions. Then go to right side, find out Position and check all access. Then click Done.

Go to section '3 Grant this role to', click Add button.

In opened page, select Everyone (All employees) in section '1: Define whom you want to grant this role permission to.'

Verify section 2: Specify the target population for the other objects.
step.expectedresults: Position is shown with two radio button All and Restrict target population to. And All is default selected.

step.actions:
Select 'Restrict target population to'.

Verify the second shown checkbox section.
step.expectedresults:
The second checkbox should be 'Include access to Position in the hierarchy below the Granted User's Position'.


Below the checkbox, there should be 3 dropdown list.
- The first one should only have option 'Higher-level position' and it should be selected by default.
- The second one should only have option = and it should be selected by default.
- The third one should have 1, 2, 3 and All options and the default one is 1. And there is a label 'level(s) down' at the right of the third dropdown.


Below the dropdowns, there should be another checkbox 'Exclude access to Granted User's Position' with checked by default.

step.actions:
Leave all checkboxes as unchecked below 'Restrict target population to'. And then click Done button.

Click 'Edit granting' link for above saved setting.

Verify the saved settings.
step.expectedresults: Target population should be set to All.

step.actions:
In section '2: Specify the target population for the other objects', select 'Restrict target population to:'

Check the checkbox 'Include access to Position in the hierarchy below the Granted User's Position'.

Set to 1 level down and uncheck 'Exclude access to Granted User's Position'.

Then click Done button.

Click 'Edit granting' link for above saved setting and verify the saved settings.
step.expectedresults: Role should be saved the same as creating.

step.actions: Do step 6 for 2, 3 and All levels down separately and verify the saved settings.
step.expectedresults: Role should be saved the save as creating.

testcase.name: Verify all operators displays normally in the drop down list in Manage Permission Role page
testcase.summary: Verify all operators displays normally in the drop down list in Manage Permission Role page

step.actions:
Preconditions:

1. Enable Generic Object

2. Enable Role-based Permission

Steps:

1. Create a GO difinition with a number type field as NumField, set Secured = Yes,Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions

2. Proceed to Manage Permission Role page and create a new role

3. Set View permission in permission settings->Miscellaneous Permissions for the GO object which created in step 1 and click done

4. Click "Add..." button to open the Grant Role page

[Verify]

(1) Object name is displays in the target population area

(2) The redio "All" and "Restric target population" is available

5. Check the redio of "Restric target population"

[Verify]

(1) Input box of field name and value is displays in empty

(2) Default operator is "="

6. Select NumField and click drop down list of operator

[Verify]

(1) Total 8 operators("=","!=",">",">=","<","<=","=null","!=null") are displays normally in the list

testcase.name: Verify all field type is supported for all operators
testcase.summary: Verify all field type is supported for all operators

step.actions:
Preconditions:

1. Enable Generic Object

2. Enable Role-based Permission

Steps:

1. Create a child object definition as "PLT_MultiOperatorTest1_CompChild"

2. Create a child object definition as "PLT_MultiOperatorTest1_VWChild"

3. Create an object instance of "PLT_MultiOperatorTest1_VWChild" as: VW1

1. Create a GO difinition "":

Custom fields:

stringField: type = String

numberField: type = Number

booleanField: type = Boolean

decimalField: type = Decimal

userField: type = User

picklistField: type = Picklist,value source = Gender

foField: type = Foundation Object,value source = location

goField: type = Generic Object, value source = Country

Set Association:

Name:Comp1, Type:Composite, Multiplicity:one to one, Destination Object: "PLT_MultiOperatorTest1_CompChild"

Name:VW1, Type:Valid When, Multiplicity:one to one, Destination Object: "PLT_MultiOperatorTest1_VWChild"

Set Secured = Yes,Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions

2. Proceed to Manage Permission Role page and create a new role

3. Set View permission in permission settings->Miscellaneous Permissions for the GO object which created in step 1 and click done

4. Click "Add..." button to open the Grant Role page

5. Set all custom field in the target population with different operator like:

stringField = 0; numberField > 2; booleanField != false; decimalField < 6; userField = cgrant1; picklistField != male; foField = Shanghai; goField != China; Comp1 !=null; VW1 = VW1;

[Verify]

(1) All the fields, operators and value can be set normally

(2) The value input box of Comp1 is grayed out.

(3) The input box of picklistField, foField, goField, Comp1 and VW1 are all drop down list.

6. Click Save button to save the role and reopen this role

[Verify]

(1) All the fields, operators and value can be saved normally

(2) The value input box of Comp1 is still grayed out.

testcase.name: Validation for the required condition field and association during follow field override
testcase.summary: Validation for the required condition field and association during follow field override

step.actions:
Create three object definition:

1. cust_conditionalSupport_Child, effective date = None

2. cust_conditionalSupport_Comp, effective date = From Parent

3. cust_conditionalSupport_Root, effective date = None, 

  • Set two custom field as cust_f1 and cust_f2
  • Set condition in cust_f2 that cust_f1 = 11.
  • Set one to many valid when association with cust_conditionalSupport_Child, set condition with cust_f1 = 11
  • Set one to many Composite association with cust_conditionalSupport_Comp, set condition with cust_f1 = 11
  • Set Secured = Yes
step.expectedresults: Object definitions can be created normally

step.actions:
Create a role for cust_conditionalSupport_Root

grant all permission for it and set field override as:

cust_f2 = Read Only

cust_VWChild = No Access

cust_CompChild = Read Only

Access group = everyone

Proceed to Manage data page, create instance for cust_conditionalSupport_Root:

externalCode = Root2,

cust_f1 = 11
step.expectedresults:
cust_f2 and cust_CompChild is displays but not able to fill the value

cust_VWChild cannot be seen

testcase.name: Value of "permission category" should be update to pre-defined permission category
testcase.preconditions:
1. Login provisioning.
2. Check "Enable MDF Dummy Objects" in company setting.
3. Update DB set permission category as new value that different from pre-condition
SQL:
update <DB schema>.generic_object_t set sf_field1 = 'Miscellaneous' WHERE parent_row_id =
(Select row_id From <DB schema>.generic_object_t Where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' And external_code = 'TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation')
And object_type = 'GORBPConfig';
 
4. Delete GO_OBJECT_DEFINITION_CACHE

step.actions:
Go to "Configure Object Definitions" page

Admin tools -> Configure Object Definitions
In "Security" section, permission category item's value was same as pre-defined permission category

Select * From <DB SCHEMA>.generic_object_t Where parent_row_id = 

        (Select row_id From <DB SCHEMA>.generic_object_t Where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' And external_code = 'TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation')
                And object_type = 'GORBPConfig';
step.expectedresults: TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation's permission category was same as pre-defined

testcase.name: Pre-defined permission category can be save to DB
testcase.preconditions:
1.Go to provisioning 

2.Check "Enable MDF Dummy Objects" in company setting.

3.Delete from <dbSchema>.generic_object_t Where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' And external_code ='TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation';

4.Delete GO_OBJECT_DEFINITION_CACHE

step.actions:
Go to "Configure Object Definitions" page

Admin tools -> Configure Object Definitions

Go to provisioning -> Monitor job

Do not execute step 3 until job is over.

Query DB:

SQL:

Select * From <DB Schema>.generic_object_t Where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' and external_code = 'TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation';
step.expectedresults: One record display

testcase.name: isRBPsecured & Permission Category should be same with Pre-defined value
testcase.summary:
isRBPsecured & Permission Category should be same with Pre-defined value

Verify that after data moudle rebuilding, RBP secured and permission category are same with pre-defined value

TestRBPAnnotation:

isRBPSecured = true

TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation:

isRBPSecured = true, permissionCategory = sap_system_mdf

TestPermissionCategory:

permissionCategory = sap_system_mdf
testcase.preconditions:
1. Login provisioning.

 

2. Check "Enable MDF Dummy Objects" in company setting.

3.Update isRBPsecured value of dummy object "TestRBPAnnotation"

SQL:  

update <DB Schema>.generic_object_t set external_code = 'NO' where object_type = 'GORBPConfig' 

        and row_id = (select ROW_ID from <DB Schema>.generic_object_t where parent_row_id = (select row_id 
          from <DB Schema>.generic_object_t where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition'
            and external_code = 'TestRBPAnnotation')and object_type = 'GORBPConfig');
 
4. Update isRBPsecured and permission category value of dummy
object "TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation"
 
SQL:
Update QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t set external_code = 'NO', sf_field1 = 'Miscellaneous Permissions' 
  where object_type = 'GORBPConfig' and row_id = (select row_id from QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t where parent_row_id = 
        (select row_id from <DB Schema>.generic_object_t where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' and external_code = 'TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation')
                and object_type = 'GORBPConfig');
 
5.Update permission category value of dummy object "TestPermissionCategory"
 
SQL:
Update QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t set sf_field1 = '' 
  where object_type = 'GORBPConfig' and row_id = (select row_id from QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t where parent_row_id = 
        (select row_id from <DB Schema>.generic_object_t where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' and external_code = 'TestPermissionCategory')
                and object_type = 'GORBPConfig');
 
6.Delete dummy objects
SQL:
Delete from <DB Schema>.generic_object_t where parent_row_id in 
      (select row_id from <DB Schema>.generic_object_t where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' 
            and external_code in ('TestRBPAnnotation','TestPermissionCategory','TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation'))               
              and object_type = 'GORBPConfig';
 
7. Delete GO_OBJECT_DEFINITION_CACHE

step.actions:
Go to "Configure Object Definitions" page

Admin tools -> Configure Object Definitions

Go to provisioning -> Monitor job

Do not execute step 3 until job is over.

Query DB:

SQL:

① Select * from QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t where parent_row_id in 

        (select row_id from QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' 
            and external_code in ('TestRBPAnnotation'))               
              and object_type = 'GORBPConfig';
 
② Select * from QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t where parent_row_id in 
        (select row_id from QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' 
            and external_code in ('TestPermissionCategory'))               
              and object_type = 'GORBPConfig';
 
③ Select * from QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t where parent_row_id in 
        (select row_id from QACANDROT_PLTMDF01L.generic_object_t where object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition' 
            and external_code in ('TestPermCategoryWithRBPAnnotation'))               
              and object_type = 'GORBPConfig';
step.expectedresults:
① YES    Miscellaneous
2017/01/03: The pre-defined values are NO, null.
② NO     sap_system_mdf
③ YES    sap_system_mdf
