testcase.name: Modify GODefinition with RBPConfig
testcase.preconditions:
1. Login as a user has permission of generic object and foundation object
2. Go to admin tools
3. Click Configure Generic Object Definition
4. Select GOObjectDefinition in Create New dropdown
5. Enter id, label, and add a field
6. Select No in securedByRBP dropdown
7. Select a value in permissionCategory
8. Click Save button.

step.actions:
1. Go to admin tools
2. Click Configure Generic Object Definition
3. Search the GODefinition created in pre-condition
4. Mouseover “Take Action” link and select “Make Correction”
5. Change securedByRBP to “Yes”, and change permissionCategory value
6. Click Save button.
[Verify]
i. What saved is displayed on UI
ii. Only 1 record in DB. RBP_CONFIG = YES, and PERMISSION_CATEGORY = <what you selected in step 5>
SQL:
select objDef.row_id, objDef.external_code obj_external_code, objRBPConfig.external_code RBP_CONFIG, objRBPConfig.sf_field1 permission_category
from <db schema>.generic_object_t objDef
join <db schema>.generic_object_t objRBPConfig on objRBPConfig.parent_row_id = objDef.row_id
where objDef.external_code = '<your definition id>'
and objRBPConfig.object_type = 'GORBPConfig'

7. Repeat step 2 – 6, and select “Custom” for securedByRBP, select a different permissionCategory value in step5
[Verify]
iii. What saved is displayed on UI
iv. Only 1 record in DB. RBP_CONFIG = CUSTOM, and PERMISSION_CATEGORY = <what you selected in step 5>

8. Repeat step 2 – 6, and select “No” for securedByRBP, select a different permissionCategory value in step5
[Verify]
v. What saved is displayed on UI
vi. Only 1 record in DB. RBP_CONFIG = NO, and PERMISSION_CATEGORY = <what you selected in step 5>

testcase.name: Change effectiveDating should not impact rbpConfig

step.actions:
1. Login as a user has permission of generic object and foundation object
2. Go to admin tools
3. Click Configure Generic Object Definition
4. Select GOObjectDefinition in Create New dropdown
5. Enter id, label, and add a field
6. Select Yes in securedByRBP dropdown
7. Select a value in permissionCategory
8. Change effectiveDating =Basic
[Verify]
i. Only 1 item under rbpConfig
ii. securedByRBP = Yes, and permissionCategory = what selected in step 7

9. Click Save button.
[Verify]
iii. Shows save successfully
iv. Only 1 record in DB
v. RBP_CONFIG = YES, and PERMISSION_CATEGORY = <what you selected in step 7>
SQL:
select objDef.row_id, objDef.external_code obj_external_code, objRBPConfig.external_code RBP_CONFIG, objRBPConfig.sf_field1 permission_category
from <db schema>.generic_object_t objDef
join <db schema>.generic_object_t objRBPConfig on objRBPConfig.parent_row_id = objDef.row_id
where objDef.external_code = '<your definition id>'
and objRBPConfig.object_type = 'GORBPConfig'

10. Go to admin tools
11. Click Configure Generic Object Definition
12. Search the GODefinition created in pre-condition
13. Mouseover “Take Action” link and select “Make Correction”
14. Change securedByRBP to “Custom”, and change permissionCategory value
15. Change effectiveDating =Multiple Changes Per Day
[Verify]
vi. Only 1 item under rbpConfig
vii. securedByRBP = Custom, and permissionCategory = what selected in step 14

16. Click Save button.
[Verify]
viii. Shows save successfully
ix. Only 1 record in DB
x. RBP_CONFIG = CUSTOM, and PERMISSION_CATEGORY = <what selected in step 14>

step.actions:
1. Login as a user has permission of generic object and foundation object

4. Select GOObjectDefinition in Create New dropdown

[Verify]

iv.The role can be saved successfully

testcase.name: MCPD: Only have view current, TC = Restricted, search and view.
testcase.preconditions:
1.      A GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = MCPD

2)      Add a field named field1

3)      securedByRBP = Yes

4)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

step.actions:
Scenario 1:

An MCPD object of GODefinirion1 with the following records:

1)      externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record1, field1 = value1, effectiveStartDate = today

2)      externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record2, field1 = value2, effectiveStartDate = today

 

1.      Create a role

1)      check view current permission for GODefinition1

2)      set TC = Restricted: field1 = value2.

2.      Login in as a user who is in access group of the role created in step1.

3.      Go to MGO page

4.      Search the object of GODefinition1.

[Verify]

                                     i.          The object (ObjectA) of GODefinition1 can be searched out.

5.      View the object searched out in step4

[Verify]

                                    ii.          No history tab shows.

                                   iii.          Only show detail of record2.

6.      Reopen the MGO page

7.      Add the following content behind the url

“#t%3A<object_type>%7Ci%3A<internal_id of the object>%7Cr%3A<row_id of the Record1>”

[Verify]

                                     i.          Record1 doesn’t show up.

 

 

Scenario 2:

An MCPD object of GODefinirion1 with the following records:

1)      externalCode = ObjectB, externalName = Record1, field1 = value1, effectiveStartDate = yesterday

2)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectB, externalName = Record2, field1 = value2, effectiveStartDate = yesterday

 

1.      Create a role

1)      check view current permission for GODefinition1

2)      set TC = Restricted: field1 = value2.

2.      Login in as a user who is in access group of the role created in step1.

3.      Go to MGO page

4.      Search the object of GODefinition1.

[Verify]

                                     i.          The object (ObjectB) can be searched out.

5.      View the object searched out in step4

[Verify]

                                    ii.          History tab doesn’t show.

                                   iii.          Only show detail of Record2.

6.      Reopen the MGO page

7.      Add the following content behind the url

“#t%3A<object_type>%7Ci%3A<internal_id of the object>%7Cr%3A<row_id of the Record1>”

[Verify]

                                   iv.          Record1 doesn’t show up.

 

Scenario 3:

An MCPD object of GODefinirion1 with the following records:

1)      externalCode = ObjectC, externalName = Record1, field1 = value1, effectiveStartDate = today

2)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectC, externalName = Record2, field1 = value2, effectiveStartDate = today

 

1.      Create a role

1)      check view current permission for GODefinition1

2)      set TC = Restricted: field1 = value1.

2.      Login in as a user who is in access group of the role created in step1.

3.      Go to MGO page

4.      Search the object of GODefinition1.

[Verify]

                                     i.          The object (ObjectC) of GODefinition1 can’t be searched out.

5.      Reopen the MGO page

6.      Add the following content behind the url

“#t%3A<object_type>%7Ci%3A<internal_id of the object>%7Cr%3A<row_id of the record1 & record2>”

[Verify]

                                    ii.          Record1 and Record2 both don’t show up.

 

Scenario 4:

An MCPD object of GODefinirion1 with the following records:

1)      externalCode = ObjectD, externalName = Record1, field1 = value1, effectiveStartDate = yesterday

2)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectD, externalName = Record2, field1 = value2, effectiveStartDate = yesterday

 

1.      Create a role

1)      check view current permission for GODefinition1

2)      set TC = Restricted: field1 = value1.

2.      Login in as a user who is in access group of the role created in step1.

3.      Go to MGO page

4.      Search the object of GODefinition1.

[Verify]

                                   iii.          The object (ObjectD) of GODefinition1 can’t be searched out.

5.      Reopen the MGO page

6.      Add the following content behind the url

“#t%3A<object_type>%7Ci%3A<internal_id of the object>%7Cr%3A<row_id of the record1 & record2>”

[Verify]

                                     i.          Record1 and Record2 both don’t show up.

testcase.name: “Including Inactives” should work when only have view current permission.
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Basic

2)      status = Editable

3)      Add a field named field1

2.      Create an object of the GODefinition created in step1.

1)      externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record1, status = inactive, field1 = value1, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/1900

2)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record2, status = active, field1 = value2, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2000

3)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record2, status = inactive, field1 = value3, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2099

3.      Create an object of the GODefinition created in step1.

1)      externalCode = ObjectB, externalName = Record1, status = inactive, field1 = value1, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/1900

2)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectB, externalName = Record2, status = inactive, field1 = value2, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2000

3)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectB, externalName = Record3, status = inactive, field1 = value3, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2099

4.      Create an object of the GODefinition created in step1.

1)      externalCode = ObjectC, externalName = Record1, status = active, field1 = value2, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/1900

2)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectC, externalName = Record2, status = inactive, field1 = value1, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2000

3)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectC, externalName = Record3, status = active, field1 = value2, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2099

5.      Correct the definition of the GODefinition created in step1 with

1)      securedByRBP = Yes               

2)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

step.actions:
1.      Create a role

1)      check view current permission for the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1

2)      set TC = Restricted: field1 = value2.

2.      Login in as a user who is in access group of the role created in step1.

3.      Go to MGO page

4.      Set Including Inactives = Yes

5.      Search the objects created in pre-condition step2-4

[Verify]

                                     i.          Both ObjectA and ObjectsB can be searched out.

                                    ii.          ObjectC can’t be searched out.

6.      Set Including Inactives = No

7.      Search the objects created in pre-condition step2-4

[Verify]

                                   iii.          ObjectA can be searched out.

                                   iv.          Both Object B and ObjectC can’t be searched out.

testcase.name: Multiple Rules: different access group.
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

{C}1)      effectiveDating = Basic

{C}2)      Add a field named field1

{C}2.      Create an object of the GODefinition created in step1.

{C}1)      externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record1, field1 = value1, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/1900

{C}2)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record2, field1 = value2, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2000

{C}3)      insert a new record: externalCode = ObjectA, externalName = Record3, field1 = value1, effectiveStartDate = 01/01/2099

{C}3.      Correct the definition of the GODefinition created in step1 with

{C}1)      securedByRBP = Yes               

{C}2)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

step.actions:
1.      Create a role

1)      check view current, view history, correct and delete permissions for the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1

2.      Add a rule

1)      Access group = Managers

2)      Set TC = Restricted: field1 = value1

3.      Add another rule

1)      Access group = Everyone

2)      Set TC = Restricted: field1 = value2

4.      Login in as a user who is not a manager.

5.      Go to MGO page

6.      Search the object created in pre-condition step2

[Verify]

                                     i.          The object can be searched out.

7.      View the object searched out in step6

[Verify]

                                    ii.          All three records show in the history tab.

                                   iii.          Only can view Record2 by clicking it.

                                   iv.          Can’t view Record1 or Record3 by clicking it.

                                    v.          Only can see “Make Correction” and “Permanent Delete” links on Record2.

8.      Make correction to externalName of Record2

9.      Save and check DB

[Verify]

                                   vi.          ExternalName value of Record2 has been changed in DB.

SQL:

select * from sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t where object_type = '<GODefinition external_code>' and external_code = '<object external_code>'

 

10.   Delete Record2

11.   Check DB

testcase.name: To verify RBP can be set on the object which has default value set
testcase.summary: To verify RBP can be set on the object which has default value set
testcase.preconditions:
• Login to application and go to Configure Object Definition
  • Create New ->Object Definition and enter code as 'cust_Obj_DefVal'
  • Change the effective dating to BASIC
  • Add new field 'cust_Test1' with String datatype and click on details link and enter Default Value as 'Release1511'
  • Select RBP as Yes, folder as Miscenelleous
  • Save the object definition
  • Go to Manage Permission Roles and click on Permission -> Miscelleneous folder
  • Select the 'cust_Obj_DefVal' object and check the boxes for Create & Insert
  • Save the permission

step.actions:
• Go to Manage data page and click in Create New -> cust_Obj_DefVal
  • observe the field 'cust_Test1'
step.expectedresults: The field should be populated with value 'Release1511'

step.actions:
• Save the object
  • Click on Take Action -> Make correction
step.expectedresults: Make Correction should not be available

step.actions:
• Now click on Insert New Record
  • Select any other past date
  • Observe the field 'cust_Test'
step.expectedresults: The field should be populated with 'Release1511' value

testcase.name: GO, Boolean fields in composite child can control parent
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Create an object definition (FieldGO)
2.       Create 2 object instances of definition in step2 (FieldGOObj1, FieldGOObj2)
3.       Create an object definition (CompositeChild) with fields
1)      BooleanField: data type = Boolean
2)      GOField: data type = GO; data source = FieldGO
4.       Create an object definition (Root) with composite
1)      Association: Name = Comp; Type = Composite; Multiplicity = One To One; Destination Object = CompositeChild
5.       Create 2 object instances of Root
1)      Root1: Add a composite (Comp1)
a)BooleanField = true
b)GOField = FieldGOObj1
2)      Root2: Add a composite (Comp2)
a)BooleanField = false
b)GOField = FieldGOObj2
6.       Get internal id of Root1 & Root2
SQL: SQL: select internal_id from sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t where object_type = ' Root ' and external_code = 'Root1'
7.       Modify the definition created in step4
1)      Security: Secured = Yes

step.actions:
1.       Login with a user with RBP permission
2.       Create a RBP role
1)      In miscellaneous, check view permission of Root and click done
2)      Create a new rule, select everyone in access group
3)      Select "Restrict target population to:"
4)      Set Comp.BooleanField = true
5)      Save role
3.       GO to manage GO page search Root
[Verify]
                              i.      Only Root1 shows up
                            ii.      Root1 detail can be viewed
4.       Update the url to view Root2: /mdf.xhtml#t%3ARoot%7Ci%3A<internal_code of Root2>
[Verify]
                              iii.      Get "No Permission" alert
5.       Edit the same role to update target criteria: Comp.GOField= FieldGOObj2
6.       GO to manage GO page search Root
[Verify]
                             iv.      Only Root2 shows up
                               v.      Root2 detail can be viewed
7.       Update the url to view Root1: /mdf.xhtml#t%3ARoot%7Ci%3A<internal_code of Root1>
[Verify]
                             vi.      Get "No Permission" alert

testcase.name: Picklist, User, DataSource fields in valid when can control parent
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable JDM 2.0 in provisioning
2.       Create a picklist (testingPicklist) with options
1)      Option1
2)      Option2
3.       Create an object definition (ValidWhenChild) with fields
1)      PLField: type = Picklist; Valid Values Source = testingPicklist
2)      UserField: type = User
3)      DSField: type = Data Source; Valid Values Source = rbpCategoryDataSource
4.       Create 2 object instances of definition in step9 (VW1, VW2)
1)      VW1.PLField = Option1
2)      VW1.UserField = Charles Grant
3)      VW1.DSField = Miscellaneous Permissions
4)      VW2.PLField = Option2
5)      VW2.UserField = Jennifer Lo
6)      VW2.DSField = Manage JDM2.0 MDF
5.       Create an object definition (Root) with fields
1)      Association: Name = VW; Type = Valid When; Multiplicity = One To Many; Destination Object = ValidWhenChild
6.       Create 2 object instances of Root
1)      Root1.VW = VW1
2)      Root2.VW = VW2
7.       Get internal id of Root1 & Root2
SQL: select internal_id from sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t where object_type = ' Root ' and external_code = 'Root1'
8.       Modify the definition created in step5
1)      Security: Secured = Yes

step.actions:

2.       Create a RBP role
1)      In miscellaneous, check view permission of Root and click done

[Verify]
                             iv.      Only Root2 shows up
                               v.      Root2 detail can be viewed

[Verify]

9.       GO to manage GO page search Root
[Verify]
                            vii.      Only Root1 shows up
                          viii.      Root1 detail can be viewed
10.   Update the url to view Root2: /mdf.xhtml#t%3ARoot%7Ci%3A<internal_code of Root2>
[Verify]
                             ix.      Get "No Permission" alert

testcase.name: One-Many: any child/child’s field meets target criteria -> Root object is accessible
testcase.summary: Currently, there's defect: http://jira.successfactors.com:8080/browse/CRF-1245
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Create 2 Workflow instances (WF1, WF2)
2.       Create a picklist (testingPicklist) with options
1)      Option1
2)      Option2
3.       Create an object definition (FieldGO) with fields
1)      PLField: type = Picklist; Valid Values Source = testingPicklist
4.       Create 2 object instances of FieldGO (FieldGOObj1, FieldGOObj2)
1)      FieldGOObj1.PLField = Option1
2)      FieldGOObj2.PLField = Option2
5.       Create an object definition (ValidWhenChild) with fields
1)      GOField: type = GO; Valid Values Source = FieldGO
6.       Create 3 object instances of ValidWhenChild
1)      VW1.GOField = FieldGOObj1
2)      VW2.GOField = FieldGOObj2
3)      VW3.GOField = FieldGOObj2
7.       Create an object definition (CompositeChild) with fields
1)      FOField: type = FO; Valid Values Source = wfConfig
8.       Create an object definition (Root) with
1)      Association: Name = VW; Type = Valid When; Multiplicity = One To Many; Destination Object = ValidWhenChild
2)      Association: Name = Comp; Type = Composite; Multiplicity = One To Many; Destination Object = CompositeChild
9.       Create 2 object instances of Root
1)      RootObj1
2)      For RootObj1, link VW1, VW2
3)      For RootObj1 create 2 composite children Comp1, Comp2 with
a)      Comp1.FOField = WF1
b)      Comp2.FOField = WF2
4)      RootObj2
5)      For RootObj2, link VW2, VW3
6)      For RootObj2 create 2 composite children Comp3, Comp4 with
a)      Comp3.FOField = WF2
b)      Comp4.FOField = WF2
10.   Modify the definition of Root
1)      Security: Secured = Yes

step.actions:
1.       Login with a user with RBP permission
2.       Create a RBP role
[check TC for VW object is working]
1)      In miscellaneous, check view permission of Root and click done
2)      Create a new rule, select everyone in access group
3)      Select "Restrict target population to:"
4)      Set VW = VW1

[check no duplication]

                             iv.      Only one RootObj1 in search result
                               v.      RootObj1 and RootObj2 detail can be viewed

                             vi.      Only RootObj1 shows up
                            vii.      RootObj1 detail can be viewed

[check no duplication]
9.       GO to manage GO page search Root
[Verify]
                          viii.      RootObj1 and RootObj2 show up
                             ix.      Only one RootObj2 in search result
                               x.      RootObj1 and RootObj2 detail can be viewed
10.   Update the role and set target criteria as VW.GOField.PLField = Option1
[check TC for field of reference object is working]
11.   GO to manage GO page search Root
[Verify]
                             xi.      Only RootObj1 shows up
                            xii.      RootObj1 detail can be viewed
12.   Update the role and set target criteria as VW.GOField.PLField = Option2
[check no duplication]
13.   GO to manage GO page search Root
[Verify]
                          xiii.      RootObj1 and RootObj2 show up
                          xiv.      Only one RootObj2 in search result
                           xv.      RootObj1 and RootObj2 detail can be viewed

[check no duplication]

testcase.name: Multi rules
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Create an object definition (ValidWhenChild) with fields

1)      Field1: type = String
2)      Field2: type = String
2.       Create 4 object instances of ValidWhenChild
1)      VW1.Field1 = Value1
2)      VW1.Field2 = Value2
3)      VW2.Field1 = Value1
4)      VW3.Field2 = Value2
5)      VW4.Field1 = Value2
3.       Create an object definition (ReferenceGO) with
1)      Association: Name = VW; Type = Valid When; Multiplicity = One To Many; Destination Object = ValidWhenChild
4.       Create 5 object instances of ReferenceGO
1)      Reference1.VW = VW1
2)      Reference2.VW = VW2, VW3
3)      Reference3.VW = VW2
4)      Reference4.VW = VW3
5)      Reference5.VW = VW4
5.       Create an object definition (Root) with fields
1)      RefField: type = GO; Valid Values Source = ReferenceGO
6.       Create 5 object instances of Root
1)      RootObj1.RefField = Reference1
2)      RootObj2.RefField = Reference2
3)      RootObj3.RefField = Reference3
4)      RootObj4.RefField = Reference4
5)      RootObj5.RefField = Reference5
7.       Get internal id of RootObj1 - RootObj5
SQL: select internal_id from sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t where object_type = 'Root ' and external_code = 'RootObj1'
8.       Modify the definition of Root
1)      Security: Secured = Yes
9.       Create a RBP role
1)      Check View permission for Root
2)      Add a rule
a)      Set a permission group (which includes userA & userC) in access group
b)      Set target criteria as RefField.VW.Field1 = Value1
3)      Add a rule
a)      Set a permission group (which includes userB & userC) in access group
b)      Set target criteria as RefField.VW.Field2 = Value2

testcase.name: Legacy data support
testcase.summary:
Befor b1305 internal id of field is saved in SF_FIELD1 for target criteria.
After b1305 dot expression is saved in SF_FIELD4 for target criteria.

This case is to make sure old data along with new data in different roles are working fine
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object in Provisioning
2.       Create 2 workflow instance (WF1, WF2, WF3)
3.       Create an object definition (PLT11321Def) with fields
1)      FOField: type = FO; data source = wfConfig;
4.       Create 2 object instances of PLT11321Def
1)      PLT11321Obj1.FOField = WF1
2)      PLT11321Obj2.FOField = WF2
3)      PLT11321Obj3.FOField = WF3
5.       Get internal id of PLT11321Obj1,  PLT11321Obj2 and PLT11321Obj3
SQL: select internal_id from sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t where object_type = 'PLT11321Def' and external_code = 'PLT11321Obj1'
6.       Modify the definition of PLT11321Def
1)      Security: Secured = Yes
7.       Create a RBP role
1)      Check view permission of PLT11321Def
2)      Add a new rule with AG = everyone
3)      Select "Restrict target population to:"
4)      Set a target criteria: FOField = WF1
5)      Save role
8.       Run SQL to put data into SF_FIELD1, and clear SF_FIELD4
update sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t detail
  set
    sf_field1 = (
    select field_def.internal_id from sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t field_def
      join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_def.row_id = field_def.parent_row_id
      where field_def.external_code = 'FOField' and obj_def.external_code = 'PLT11321Def'
    ),
    sf_field4 = null
  where detail.parent_row_id = (
    select tc.row_id
      from sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_role
      left join sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_rule on rbp_perm_role.role_id = rbp_perm_rule.role_id
      left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc_map on tc_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_rule.rule_id)
      left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc on tc.parent_row_id = tc_map.row_id
      where role_name = '<RoleName>' and tc_map.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaMap'
    )
9.       Create another RBP role
1)      Check view permission of PLT11321Def
2)      Add a new rule with AG = everyone
3)      Select "Restrict target population to:"
4)      Set a target criteria: FOField = WF3
5)      Save role

step.actions:
1.       Login as admin
2.       Go to manage GO page to search PLT11321Def
[Verify]
                              i.      PLT11321Obj1 can be searched out
                            ii.      PLT11321Obj1 can be viewed
                           iii.      PLT11321Obj3 can be searched out
                          iv.      PLT11321Obj3 can be viewed
3.       Update the url to view PLT11321Obj2: /mdf.xhtml#t%3ARoot%7Ci%3A<internal_code of PLT11321Obj2>
[Verify]
                          vi.      Get "No Permission" alert

testcase.name: EffectiveDated GO field of Composite child
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object in Provisioning
2.       Create an object definition PLT13480FieldGODef
1)      effectiveDating = Basic
2)      Add a field: Field1
3.       Create an object instance of PLT13480FieldGODef : FieldGO1
1)      Record1: externalName = record1; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/1900; Field1 = a
2)      Record2: externalName = record2; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2000; Field1 = b
3)      Record3: externalName = record3; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2099; Field1 = c
4.       Create an object definition PLT13480CompDef
1)      Add a field: GOField; data source = PLT13480FieldGODef
5.       Create an object definition PLT13480RootDef
1)      effectiveDating = Basic
2)      Association: Name = Comp; Type = Composite; Multiplicity = One To Many; Destination Object = PLT13480CompDef
6.       Create 2 object instances of PLT13480RootDef
1)      Root1
a)         Record1: externalName = record1; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/1900; Comp: Comp1, GOField = FieldGO1
b)         Record2: externalName = record2; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2000; Comp: Comp1, GOField = FieldGO1
c)          Record3: externalName = record3; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2099; Comp: Comp1, GOField = FieldGO1
2)      Root2
a)         Record1: externalName = record1; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2099; Comp: Comp2, GOField = FieldGO1
7.       Update PLT13480RootDef
1)      Set security = Yes

step.actions:
1.       Create a RBP role
1)      Check view history permission of PLT13480RootDef
2)      Rule1: Access group only includes user1, target criteria: Comp.GOField.Field1 = b
3)      Rule2: Access group only includes user2, target criteria: Comp.GOField.Field1 = c
2.       Login as user1
3.       Search and view Root1
[Verify]
                              i.      Record2 shows up with data
                            ii.      Record1 and record3 show up with no permission in history tab
4.       Set date = 1/1/2099 and search Root2
[Verify]
                              i.      No result
5.       Update URL to view Root2
[Verify]
                              i.      No permission alert
6.       Login as user2
7.       Set date = 1/1/2099, search and view Root2
[Verify]
                              i.      Record1 shows up with data
8.       Set date = 1/1/2099, search Root1
 [Verify]
                              i.      Record3 is searched out
9.       View Root1
[Verify]
                              i.      No permission alert

1). Create two none type definitions cust_FOGGORef & cust_FOGVWDef
2). Create 4 composite definitions cust_FOGCompDef1 & cust_FOGCompDef2 & cust_FOGCompDef3 & cust_FOGCompDef4
3). Create a composite definition cust_FOCompDef1: secured = yes
add a user type field cust_userF
1:1 composite associated to cust_FOGCompDef1 with association name cust_comp1
1:M composite associated to cust_FOGCompDef2 with association name cust_comp2
1:1 vw associated to cust_FOGVWDef with association name cust_vw1
1:M vw associated to cust_FOGVWDef with association name cust_vw2
4). Create a composite definition cust_FOCompDef2: secured = yes
add a go type field cust_goF, Valid Values Source = cust_FOGGORef
1:1 composite associated to cust_FOGCompDef3 with association name cust_comp3
1:M composite associated to cust_FOGCompDef4 with association name cust_comp4
1:1 vw associated to cust_FOGVWDef with association name cust_vw3
1:M vw associated to cust_FOGVWDef with association name cust_vw4
5). Create a basic type definition cust_FOParentDef: secured = yes
1:1 composite associated to cust_FOCompDef1 with association name cust_compCH1
1:M composite associated to cust_FOCompDef2 with association name cust_compCH2
2. Create a role named Role_CompositeNoOverride(delete role Role_CompositeNoAccess and Role_CompositeReadOnly if exist)
1） Check all permission of cust_FOParentDef, cust_FOCompDef1, cust_FOCompDef2
2) Acess group = everyone
3. Import attached Instances.zip
Root1, 01/01/2010
---cust_compCH1: Comp1, externalName = c1, cust_userF = admin
-------cust_comp1: GComp1, externalName = gc1
-------cust_comp2: GComp2, externalName = gc2
-------cust_vw1： VW1
-------cust_vw2： VW2
---cust_compCH2: Comp2, externalName = c2, cust_goF = GO1
-------cust_comp3: GComp3, externalName = gc3
-------cust_comp4: GComp4, externalName = gc4
-------cust_vw3： VW1
-------cust_vw4： VW2

step.actions: Go to Manage data page and check
step.expectedresults: Root1 with association cust_compCH1 & cust_compCH2 are displayed normally

step.actions: Click Take Action --> Make Correction:
step.expectedresults:
1) externalCode, effectiveStartDate, externalName of Root1 are editable status
2) fields and assoications of cust_compCH1 & cust_compCH2 are editable stauts

step.actions:
Update the role Role_CompositeNoOverride:
1) set field override for cust_FOCompDef1:
cust_comp1, cust_comp2, cust_vw1, cust_vw2, cust_userF, externalName = read only
2) set field override for cust_FOCompDef2:
cust_comp3, cust_comp4, cust_vw3, cust_vw4, cust_goF, externalName = read only
Go to Manage data page and check
step.expectedresults: Root1 with association cust_compCH1 & cust_compCH2 are displayed normally

step.actions: Click Take Action --> Make Correction:
step.expectedresults:
1) externalCode, effectiveStartDate, externalName of Root1 are editable status
2) externalCode of cust_compCH1 & cust_compCH2 are editable status, other properties of cust_compCH1 & cust_compCH2 are read only status

step.actions:
Update the role Role_CompositeNoOverride:
1) update field override for cust_FOCompDef1:
cust_comp1, cust_comp2, cust_vw1, cust_vw2, cust_userF, externalName = no access
2) update field override for cust_FOCompDef2:
cust_comp3, cust_comp4, cust_vw3, cust_vw4, cust_goF, externalName = no access
Go to manage data page and check:
step.expectedresults:
1) externalCode, effectiveStartDate, externalName of Root1, 01/01/2010 are displayed
2) only externalCode of cust_compCH1 & cust_compCH2 are displayed, other properties of cust_compCH1 & cust_compCH2 are not displayed

step.actions: Click Take Action --> Make Correction:
step.expectedresults:
1) externalCode, effectiveStartDate, externalName of Root1 are editable status
2) externalCode of cust_compCH1 & cust_compCH2 are editable status, other properties of cust_compCH1 & cust_compCH2 are invisible

testcase.name: check manage data page behavior if composite is no access
testcase.summary: check manage data page behavior if composite is no access
testcase.preconditions:
1. Import attached Definition.zip, include below definitions
1). Create two none type definitions cust_FOGGORef & cust_FOGVWDef
2). Create 4 composite definitions cust_FOGCompDef1 & cust_FOGCompDef2 & cust_FOGCompDef3 & cust_FOGCompDef4
3). Create a composite definition cust_FOCompDef1: secured = yes
add a user type field cust_userF
1:1 composite associated to cust_FOGCompDef1 with association name cust_comp1
1:M composite associated to cust_FOGCompDef2 with association name cust_comp2
1:1 vw associated to cust_FOGVWDef with association name cust_vw1
1:M vw associated to cust_FOGVWDef with association name cust_vw2
4). Create a composite definition cust_FOCompDef2: secured = yes
add a go type field cust_goF, Valid Values Source = cust_FOGGORef
1:1 composite associated to cust_FOGCompDef3 with association name cust_comp3
1:M composite associated to cust_FOGCompDef4 with association name cust_comp4
1:1 vw associated to cust_FOGVWDef with association name cust_vw3
1:M vw associated to cust_FOGVWDef with association name cust_vw4
5). Create a basic type definition cust_FOParentDef: secured = yes
1:1 composite associated to cust_FOCompDef1 with association name cust_compCH1
1:M composite associated to cust_FOCompDef2 with association name cust_compCH2
2. Create a role named Role_CompositeNoAccess(delete role Role_CompositeReadOnly and Role_CompositeNoOverride if exist)
1） Check all permission of cust_FOParentDef, cust_FOCompDef1, cust_FOCompDef2
2) Acess group = everyone
3. Import attached Instances.zip
Root1, 01/01/2010
---cust_compCH1: Comp1, externalName = c1, cust_userF = admin

-------cust_comp2: GComp2, externalName = gc2
-------cust_vw1： VW1
-------cust_vw2： VW2

-------cust_comp4: GComp4, externalName = gc4

-------cust_vw4： VW2

testcase.name: Association in Parent's field override - User Based (multiple role/rule)
testcase.summary:
1.       Enable Generic Object, Foundation Object in Provisioning
2.       Create an object definition PLT12900Comp1ChildDef
1)      Field1, field2, field3, field4
3.       Create an object definition PLT12900Comp2ChildDef
4.       Create an object definition PLT12900VWChildDef
5.       Create an object instance of PLT12900VWChildDef
1)      externalCode = VW1
2)      externalCode = VW2
6.       Create an object definition PLT12900RootDef
1)      externalCode: type = User
2)      Association: name = CompAsso1; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT12900Comp1ChildDef
3)      Association: name = CompAsso2; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12900Comp2ChildDef
4)      Association: name = VWAsso1; type = valid when; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT12900VWChildDef
5)      Association: name = VWAsso2; type = valid when; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12900VWChildDef
7.       Create object instances for PLT12900RootDef
1)      cgrant
a.CompAsso1: Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2
b.CompAsso2: Asso2Child1
c.VWAsso1: VW1, VW2
d.VWAsso2: VW1
2)      mhoff
a.CompAsso1: Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2
b.CompAsso2: Asso2Child1
c.VWAsso1: VW1, VW2
d.VWAsso2: VW1
8.       Update definition PLT12900RootDef
1)      Security: Secured = Yes; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
9.       Create a RBP role: PLT12900Role1
1)      Check permission: View and Edit of PLT12900RootDef
2)      Field override settings
a.CompAsso1: read only
b.CompAsso2: no access
c.VWAsso1: read only
d.VWAsso2: no access
3)      Rule
a.Access group: mhoff, cgrant, admin
b.Target population: everyone
10.   Create a RBP role: PLT12900Role2
1)      Check permission: View and Edit of PLT12900RootDef
2)      Field override settings
a.CompAsso1: no access
b.CompAsso2: read only
c.VWAsso1: no access
d.VWAsso2: read only
3)      Rule
a.Access group: jlo, admin
b.Target population: everyone
11.   Create a RBP role: PLT12900Role3
1)      Check permission: View and Edit of PLT12900RootDef
2)      Rule
a.Access group: mhoff
b.Target population: cgrant
12.   Create an object definition: PLT12900Unrelated
1)      Security: Secured = Yes; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
13.   Create a RBP role: PLT12900Unrelated
1)      Check permission: View and Edit of PLT12900Unrelated
2)      Rule
a.Access group: everyone

 

b.Target criteria: all

testcase.preconditions:

2). Create 4 composite definitions cust_FOGCompDef1 & cust_FOGCompDef2 & cust_FOGCompDef3 & cust_FOGCompDef4
3). Create a composite definition cust_FOCompDef1: secured = yes
add a user type field cust_userF

add a go type field cust_goF, Valid Values Source = cust_FOGGORef

testcase.name: Verify multiple-parent composite follow RBP setting
testcase.summary: Verify multiple-parent composite follow RBP setting
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a composite child definition cust_Comp: effective dating = From Parent
2. Create a GO definition cust_Parent1:
effective dating = None
1:1 composite associated to cust_Comp with association name cust_comp
3. Create a GO definition cust_Parent2:
effective dating = None
1:M composite associated to cust_Comp with association name cust_comp
4. Create instance for cust_Parent1:
Root1_P1,
cust_comp:
externalCode = Comp1, externalName = comp1
5. Create instance for cust_Parent2:
Root1_P2,
cust_comp:
externalCode = Comp1, externalName = comp1
6. Update definition cust_Comp: Secured =Yes, Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions

step.actions: Go to Manage Data page and search instances for cust_Parent1 & cust_Parent2
step.expectedresults: cust_comp don't display in both Root1_P1 & Root1_P2

step.actions: Create a role for cust_Parent1.comp and grant view permission to everyone
Go to Manage Data page and search instances for cust_Parent1 & cust_Parent2 again
step.expectedresults: Root1_P1 & Root1_P2 are displayed correctly as created by precondition 4 & 5

step.actions: Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P1 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is read only statue, cant be edited

step.actions: Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P2 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is read only statue, cant be edited

step.actions: Update the role, add Correct permission to everyone
Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P1 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is editable statue, no delete/adjust buttom

step.actions: Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P2 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is editable statue, no delete/adjust buttom, cant add new composite child

step.actions: Edit Root1_P1 to update Comp1: externalName = comp1_update1
step.expectedresults:
Comp1 under Root1_P1 can be updated correctly
Comp1 under Root1_P2 wont be affected

step.actions: Edit Root1_P2 to update Comp1: externalName = comp1_update2
step.expectedresults:
Comp1 under Root1_P2 can be updated correctly
Comp1 under Root1_P1 wont be affected

step.actions: Update the role, add create permission to everyone
Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P1 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is editable statue, no delete/adjust buttom

step.actions: Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P2 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is editable statue, no delete/adjust buttom, can add new composite child

step.actions: Edit Root1_P2 to add composite child: externalCode = Comp2, externalName = comp2
step.expectedresults:
Comp2 under Root1_P2 can be created
Comp1 under Root1_P1 & Comp1 under Root1_P2 wont be affected

step.actions: Update the role, add adjust order permission to everyone and uncheck create permission
Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P1 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is editable statue, no delete/adjust buttom

step.actions: Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P2 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is editable statue, no delete buttom, can see adjust buttom, cant add new composite child

step.actions: Edit Root1_P2 to adjust composite child order
step.expectedresults: Can adjust order successfully

step.actions: Update the role, add delete permission to everyone, and uncheck adjust permission
Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P1 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is editable statue, can see delete buttom, no adjust buttom

step.actions: Click Take Action--> Make Correction for Root1_P2 and verify
step.expectedresults: cust_comp is editable statue, can see delete buttom, no adjust buttom, cant add new composite child

step.actions: Edit Root1_P2 to delete composite child: Comp2
step.expectedresults:
Comp2 under Root1_P2 can be deleted
Comp1 under Root1_P1 & Comp1 under Root1_P2 wont be affected

step.actions: Edit Root1_P1 to delete composite child: Comp1
step.expectedresults:
Comp1 under Root1_P1 can be deleted
Comp1 under Root1_P2 wont be affected

testcase.name: No data loss when edit an object with association is read only or no access
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object, Foundation Object in Provisioning
2.       Create an object definition PLT12901Comp1ChildDef
3.       Create an object definition PLT12901Comp2ChildDef
4.       Create an object definition PLT12901VWChildDef
5.       Create 2 object instances of PLT12901VWChildDef
1)      externalCode = VW1
2)      externalCode = VW2
6.       Create an object definition PLT12901RootDef
1)      effectiveDating = Basic
2)      Association: name = CompAsso1; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT12901Comp1ChildDef
3)      Association: name = CompAsso2; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12901Comp2ChildDef
4)      Association: name = VWAsso1; type = valid when; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT12901VWChildDef
5)      Association: name = VWAsso2; type = valid when; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT12901VWChildDef
7.       Create object instances for PLT12901RootDef
1)      Root1
a.effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2000
b.CompAsso1: Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2
c.CompAsso2: Asso2Child1
d.VWAsso1: VW1, VW2
e.VWAsso2: VW1
8.       Update definition PLT12901RootDef
1)      Security: Secured = Yes; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
9.       Create a RBP role: PLT12901Role1
1)      Check permission: all permissions of PLT12901RootDef
2)      Field override settings
a.CompAsso1: no access
b.CompAsso2: read only
c.VWAsso1: no access
d.VWAsso2: read only
3)      Rule
a.Access group: cgrant
b.Target criteria: all
10.   Create a RBP role: PLT12901Role2
1)      Check permission: all permissions of PLT12901RootDef
2)      Rule
a.Access group: admin
b.Target criteria: all

step.actions:
1.       Login as cgrant
2.       Search Root1
3.       Make correction
[Verify]
                              i.      CompAsso1 is invisible
                            ii.      CompAsso2 is not editable
4.       Update the externalName of Root1
5.       Save changes
6.       Login as admin
7.       Search Root1
 [Verify]
                              i.      externalName is the same as step4 entered
                            ii.      CompAsso1 has Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2
                           iii.      CompAsso2 has Asso2Child1
                          iv.      VWAsso1 has VW1, VW2
                            v.      VWAsso2 has VW1

testcase.name: Multiple-parent composite with parent has field override
testcase.summary: Multiple-parent composite with parent has field override
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a composite child definition cust_Comp: effective dating = From Parent
2. Create a GO definition cust_Parent1:
effective dating = None
1:1 composite associated to cust_Comp with association name cust_comp
3. Create a GO definition cust_Parent2:
effective dating = None
1:M composite associated to cust_Comp with association name cust_comp
4. Create instance for cust_Parent1:
Root1_P1,
cust_comp:
externalCode = Comp1, externalName = comp1
5. Create instance for cust_Parent2:
Root1_P2,
cust_comp:
externalCode = Comp1, externalName = comp1
6. Update definition cust_Parent1 & cust_Parent2: Secured =Yes, Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
7. Create a role:
grant all persmission for cust_Parent1, add field override: comp = Read Only

step.actions:
Preconditions

1. Enable Generic Object, Foundation Object in Provisioning

2. Create an object definition PLT13247Comp1ChildDef

4. Create an object definition PLT13247Comp3ChildDef

5. Create 2 object definitions PLT13247VW1ChildDef,PLT13247VW2ChildDef

6. Create 2 object instances of PLT13247VW1ChildDef

1) externalCode = VW1_1

2) externalCode = VW1_2

7. Create an object instances of PLT13247VW2ChildDef

1) externalCode = VW2_1

8. Create an object definition PLT13247RootDef

1) effectiveDating = None

2) Association: name = CompAsso1; type = composite; Visibility=Editable; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT13247Comp1ChildDef

3) Association: name = CompAsso2; type = composite; Visibility=Read Only; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13247Comp2ChildDef

4) Association: name = CompAsso3; type = composite; Visibility=Editable; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13247Comp3ChildDef

5) Association: name = VWAsso1; type = valid when; Visibility=Editable; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT13247VW1ChildDef

6) Association: name = VWAsso2; type = valid when; Visibility=Not Visible; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13247VW1ChildDef

7) Association: name = VWAsso3; type = valid when; Visibility=Editable; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13247VW2ChildDef

Steps:

1. Login as admin

2. Create object instances for PLT13247RootDef

1) externalCode = Root1

2) Create and observe the Composite Child: CompAsso1: Asso1Child1 and Asso1Child2, CompAsso3:Asso3Child1

[Verify]

i. CompAsso2 is not available for create

4) Create and observe the ValidWhen Child: VWAsso1: VW1_1, VW1_2 and VWAsso3: VWAsso3:VW2_1

[Verify]

i. VWAsso2 is not exist

3. Save changes

4. Update all the definition of composite child and valid when child

Set Security: Secured = Yes ; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions

5. Create a RBP role: PLT13247Role1

1) Check permission: View permissions of PLT13247Comp1ChildDef,PLT13247Comp2ChildDef

2) Rule

a.Access group: admin

b.Target criteria: all

6. Search Root1

[Verify]

i. CompAsso1 has Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2

ii. CompAsso2 is empty

iii. CompAsso3 is not exist

iv. VWAsso1 has VW1_1, VW1_2

iv. VWAsso2 is not exist

v. VWAsso3 has VW2_1

7. Login as cgrant

8. Search Root1

[Verify]

i. all composite child are not exist

ii. VWAsso1 and VWAsso3 is displays normally

step.actions:
Preconditions
1.       Enable Generic Object, Foundation Object in Provisioning
2.       Create an object definition PLT13250Comp1ChildDef
         field: field1, String type
         Security: Secured = Yes ; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
3.       Create an object definition PLT13250Comp2ChildDef
         field: field1, String type
         Security: Secured = Yes ; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
4.       Create an object definition PLT13250Comp3ChildDef
         field: field1, String type
         Security: Secured = Yes ; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
5.       Create an object definition PLT13250VW1ChildDef
         field: field1, String type
         Security: Secured = Yes ; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
6.       Create an object definition PLT13250VW2ChildDef
         field: field1, String type
         Security: Secured = Yes ; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
7.               Create Role PLT13250VWChild with Edit permission for PLT13250VW1Child and PLT13250VW2Child, Access group is everyone
8.       Create 2 object instances of PLT13250VW1ChildDef
1)      externalCode = VW1_1
2)      externalCode = VW1_2
9.       Create an object instances of PLT13250VW2ChildDef
1)      externalCode = VW2_1,VW2_2
10.          Update the Role PLT13250VWChild to inactive
11.       Create an object definition PLT13250RootDef
1)      effectiveDating = Basic
2)      Association: name = CompAsso1; type = composite; Visibility=Editable; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT13250Comp1ChildDef
3)      Association: name = CompAsso2; type = composite; Visibility=Read Only; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13250Comp2ChildDef
4)      Association: name = CompAsso3; type = composite; Visibility=Editable; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13250Comp3ChildDef
5)      Association: name = VWAsso1; type = valid when; Visibility=Editable; Multiplicity = one to many; destination object = PLT13250VW1ChildDef
6)      Association: name = VWAsso2; type = valid when; Visibility=Not Visible; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13250VW1ChildDef
7)      Association: name = VWAsso3; type = valid when; Visibility=Editable; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13250VW2ChildDef
 
Steps:
1.Login as admin
2. Create the RBP role: PLT13250Role1
1) Check permission: Correct,create permissions of PLT13250Comp1ChildDef,PLT13250Comp2ChildDef
2)Rule
a.Access group: admin
b.Target criteria: all
 
3. Create object instances for PLT13250RootDef
externalCode = Root1
effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2000
Create the Composite Child: CompAsso1: Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2, Asso1Child3
Create Valid When Child: VWAsso1 and VWAsso3: VW1_1, VW1_2 and VW2_1
 
4.update the role (PLT13250Role1) created in step 2: 
Check permission → select “Field override settings“ of PLT13250Comp1ChildDef
field1: no access
externalCode: read only
 
 
5. Search the object instances "Root1" for PLT13250RootDef
6. Click Take Action->Make Correction to update the object.
Update Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2, set externalName as Asso1Child1_updated, Asso1Child2_updated
Update VW1_1 to VW1_2 and , VW1_2 to VW1_1, VW2_1 to VW2_2
[Verify]
i. CompAsso1 "Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2" are available for update, externalCode is not able to update and field1 is not shown in the page
ii. VWAsso1, VWAsso3 are available for update to another object instance
iii. CompAsso2 is Read Only and not available to update.
iv. CompAsso3 and VWAsso2 are not exist
7. Save changes
8. Search Root1
[Verify]
i. CompAsso1 has Asso1Child1, Asso1Child2 with externalName:Asso1Child1_updated, Asso1Child2_updated
ii. CompAsso2 is empty
iii. VWAsso1 has VW1_2, VW1_1, VWAsso3 has VW2_2
iv. CompAsso3, VWAsso2 are not exist
9. Login as cgrant
10. Search Root1
[Verify]
i. all composite child is not exist

iii. rootNoAcc field can be seen

3. Click the link of Make correction

[Verify]

i. NoAccInoverride of CompAsso1 is read only.

ii. rootNoAcc field is readonly

3. Update the externalName of CompAsso1 to "updatedCompChild"

4. Update the externalName of PLT13257RootDef to "updatedRootField"

5. Save the changes and search the object of Root1

[Verify]

i. The externalName of CompAsso1 and PLT13257RootDef have been updated normally

6. Update the role: PLT13257Role1, remove all the field override settings and un-check the field override.

7. Save the roles and search the object of Root1.

[Verify]

i. CompAsso1 dispalys normally with correct fields value: NoAccInOverride=NoAcc

ii. rootNoAcc displays normally in the root object, value is "NoAcc"

2)      F2: type = String

a)      effectiveStartDate = 1/1/1900
b)      Comp1.Field1 = Value1
c)       Comp1.Field2 = Value2
d)      effectiveStartDate = 1/2/1900
e)      Comp1.Field1 = Value1
f)       Comp1.Field2 = Value2
2)      RootObj2
a)      effectiveStartDate = 1/1/1900
b)      Comp2.Field1 = Value1

3)      Set target criteria as Comp.Field2 = Value2
