Go to change the security of definition:position to yes.

Permission Category:Miscellaneous Permission

step.actions:
Go to manage permission role to create a permission role:RoleForPosition

Grant all the permission to position

Grant this role to everybody
Make sure check the box:
step.expectedresults: there should be red box warning the code box is empty and the permission role cannot be saved.

step.actions:
choose code in the code box;

 

leave the code name as empty,click finish to save the role

Fill the code name as 'P12385_a',save the role
step.expectedresults:
there is warning message like:please provide a valid entry for: string

the role cannot be saved 

 

the role is saved correctly

step.actions:
For the customer already saved with null field, we do update with SQL below:

update QACANDROT_PLTEmma1.generic_object_t set sf_field1=null where sf_field3='P12385_a';

open the role again , the code and code name become null , click finish
step.expectedresults: there should be red box to warn to fill the value

step.actions:
fill the value as code=P12385_a,

save the role
step.expectedresults: the role can be saved with no error

step.actions:
run the SQL:

update QACANDROT_PLTEmma1.generic_object_t set sf_field3=null where sf_field3='P12385_a';

go to the permission role page to open the role again
step.expectedresults: the code name becomes empty

step.actions:
click finish

 

fill the code name:P12385_a

save the role
step.expectedresults:
cannot be saved,

there is red box warning to fill the value

the role can be saved

step.actions:
Run the SQL:

update QACANDROT_PLTEmma1.generic_object_t set sf_field3=null and sf_field1=null where external_code='f5292c6f36b84a6fa4bdddb44d9a293b';

open the role again ,click finish
step.expectedresults:
the role can be opened correctly

 

the boxes becomes empty,

there are two red box warning to fill the value.

testcase.name: one-level hierarchy position works in target population
testcase.summary: http://jira.successfactors.com/browse/XAF-2352
testcase.preconditions:
1.Make sure there is definition named:position in generic object definition

2.Go to manage data page to create basic type positions with the hierarchy: position1; position2_1 and position2_2 with parent position:position1;position3 with parent position:position2_1;position4 with position3;position5 with position4.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2000 insert record 01/01/2010

3.Create an another hierarchy:position6,position7 with parent position6,position8 with parent position7.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2000 insert record 01/01/2010

step.actions:
• create a permission role:Level_one
  • Add view current permission to all the positions
  • Grant role to everyone
  • In the position hierarchy option chart, choose position.code=position1 and levels down=1
go to manage data to check
step.expectedresults: only position1 and position2_1 and position2_2 of 01/01/2010 can be viewed but aren't editable

step.actions:
• Change the position.code=position3 and levels down=1
  • go to manage data page to check
step.expectedresults: only position3 and position4 in record 01/01/2010 can be viewed but aren't editable

step.actions: Change the permission role adding view history permission to do the upper testing again
step.expectedresults: the target position of both records can be viewed.

step.actions: Grant the role to cgrant to do the upper testing again
step.expectedresults: only cgrant has the upper permission

testcase.name: two-level hierarchy position works in target population
testcase.preconditions:
1.Make sure there is definition named:position in generic object definition

2.Go to manage data page to create basic type positions with the hierarchy: position1; position2_1 and position2_2 with parent position:position1;position3 with parent position:position2_1;position4 with position3;position5 with position4.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2000 insert record 01/01/2010

3.Create an another hierarchy:position6,position7 with parent position6,position8 with parent position7.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2000 insert record 01/01/2010

step.actions:
• Create a permission role: Two_Level
  • Add view permission to all the positions
  • Grant role to everyone
  • In the position hierarchy option chart, choose position.code=position1 and levels down=2

• Create another permission role: Two_Level_2
  • Add delete permission to all the positions,grant role to everyone
  • In the position hierarchy option chart, choose position.code=position6 and levels down=1
go to manage data to check
step.expectedresults:
only position4,position5,position8 cannot be viewed, others can be viewed and deleted but aren't editable

Jan 5, 2017: position1, position2_1, position2_2, position3 can only be viewed.

Position6, position 7 can be viewed and deleted.

step.actions: Change the permission role adding edit(create insert correct) permission to Two_Level_2 to do the upper testing
step.expectedresults: the target position will have the edit(create insert correct) permission.

step.actions: Grant the role to cgrant to do the testing
step.expectedresults: only cgrant have the permission of the target position.

testcase.name: three-level hierarchy position works in target population
testcase.preconditions:
1.Make sure there is definition named:position in generic object definition

2.Go to manage data page to create basic type positions with the hierarchy: position1; position2_1 and position2_2 with parent position:position1;position3 with parent position:position2_1;position4 with position3;position5 with position4.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2000 insert record 01/01/2010

3.Create an another hierarchy:position6,position7 with parent position6,position8 with parent position7.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2000 insert record 01/01/2010

step.actions:
• Create a permission role: Three_Level
  • Add view permission to all the positions
  • Grant role to everyone
  • In the position hierarchy option chart, choose position.code=position2_1 and levels down=3
  • Add another rule to change the position.code=position1 and levels down=3
  • Grant the role to everyone.
go to manage data to check
step.expectedresults: except position6,position7,position8, others can be viewed.

testcase.name: Show label for GODefinition and field
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable zh_CN language pack in provisioning

2.       Login as a user has permission of generic object

3.       Add zh_CN in translation (refer to https://confluence/display/ENG/Configuration+of+Translations+for+Generic+Objects)

4.       Create a GODefinition with

1)      label different from id, click translation icon to add Chinese label

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

4)      Add a field, click detail to add a label which is different from field name, and add Chinese label for the field

step.actions:
1.       Login as a user has permission “Manage Role-Based Permission Access”

2.       Create a new role

3.       Click “Permission…” button

4.       Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

[Verify]

i.         GODefinition created in pre-condition step4 shows up. And shows label instead of id

 

5.       Check some permission of GODefinition created in pre-condition step4 and click done

[Verify]

ii.       GODefinition created in pre-condition step4 shows up. And shows label instead of id in “Permission requiring MDF object target” section

 

6.       Click “Add…” button

7.       Select “Restrict target population to”

[Verify]

iii.      GODefinition created in pre-condition step4 shows up. And shows label instead of id

iv.     The field created in pre-condition step4.4 shows up. And shows label instead of name

 

8.       Change the login user’s language to zh_CN

9.       Repeat step 2 – 7

[Verify]

v.       Chinese label for GODefinition and field is showing up

testcase.name: Permission change can be cancelled and can be made twice
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Login as a user has permission of generic object

2.       Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = None

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

3.       Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Basic

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

4.       Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Multiple Changes Per Day

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

step.actions:
1.       Login as a user has permission “Manage Role-Based Permission Access”

2.       Create a new role

3.       Select permission

1)      Click “Permission…” button

2)      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

3)      Only check view, edit for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

4)      Only check view current for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

5)      Only check create, delete, insert, correct for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4

6)      Click “Done” button

4.       Click “Add…” button to add a rule

5.       Select everyone and click done

6.       Click save changes

7.       Edit the same role, but choose cancel for permission change

1)      Click “Permission…” button

2)      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

3)      Uncheck edit for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

4)      Check create for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

5)      Uncheck view history for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4

6)      Click “Cancel” button

8.       Click save changes

[Verify]

i.         In DB, sf_field1 and sf_field2 = true for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2. Other fields = false

ii.       In DB, sf_field3 = true for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3. Other fields = false

iii.      In DB, sf_field3 ~ sf_field8 = true for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4. Other fields = false

SQL:

select obj_perm.sf_field1, obj_perm.sf_field2, obj_perm.sf_field3, obj_perm.sf_field4, obj_perm.sf_field5, obj_perm.sf_field6, obj_perm.sf_field7, obj_perm.sf_field8

  from sfqa4_zsystem01.rbp_perm_role

  join sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t role_obj_perm_map on role_obj_perm_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_role.role_id)

  join sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t obj_perm on role_obj_perm_map.row_id = obj_perm.parent_row_id

  join sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_perm.external_code = obj_def.internal_id

  where role_name = '<role name>' and role_obj_perm_map.object_type = 'RBPRoleObjectPermissionMap'

    and obj_def.external_code = '<id of GODefinition>'

 

9.       Edit the same role, but choose cancel for permission change

1)      Click “Permission…” button

2)      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

3)      Uncheck edit for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

4)      Check create for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

5)      Uncheck view history for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4

6)      Click “Cancel” button

10.   Click “Permission…” button

11.   Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

[Verify]

iv.     Changes made in step 9 is not applied, all permission selection should be the same as step 3

 

12.   Made some changes

1)      Check insert for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

2)      Uncheck delete for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4

3)      Click Done

13.   Click “Permission…” button

14.   Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

[Verify]

v.       Changes made in step 12 is applied, all permission selection should be the same as step 12

 

15.   Made some new changes

1)      Uncheck edit for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

2)      Check create for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

3)      Uncheck correct for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4

4)      Click Done

16.   Click “Permission…” button

17.   Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

[Verify]

vi.     Changes made in step 15 is applied, all permission selection should be the same as step 15

 

18.   Click “Cancel” button

19.   Click save changes

[Verify]

vii.    In DB, sf_field1 = true for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2. Other fields = false

viii.  In DB, sf_field3, sf_field5, sf_field6 = true for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3. Other fields = false

ix.     In DB, sf_field3, sf_field4, sf_field5, sf_field6 = true for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4. Other fields = false

testcase.name: Verify role without target criteria permission can be created and updated normally
testcase.summary:
Verify role without target criteria permission can be created and updated normally

Related defect:

VersionOne Ticket: D-25262
testcase.preconditions:
1. Enable Generic object

2. Enable Role-Based permission

step.actions: Login with admin user and proceed to Manage Permission Roles

Create a new role:

  • Tick Permission: General User Permission-> User Login
  • Access group: admin

Click Save button.
step.expectedresults: The role can be saved normally

step.actions: Reopen the role, Click save button again.
step.expectedresults: The role can be updated normally

testcase.name: Only selected GODefinition will be shown in target criteria section
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Login as a user has permission of generic object

2.       Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = None

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

3.       Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Basic

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

4.       Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Multiple Changes Per Day

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

step.actions:
1.       Login as a user has permission “Manage Role-Based Permission Access”

2.       Create a new role

3.       Click “Add…” button to add a rule

[Verify]

i.         Only access group section shows up with “Exclude self” checkbox

 

4.       Select everyone and click done

5.       Select permission

1)      Click “Permission…” button

2)      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

3)      Only check view for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

4)      Only check view current for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

5)      Only check create for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4

6)      Click “Done” button

6.       Click “Edit Granting”

[Verify]

ii.       Section “2: Specify the target population for the other objects.” Shows up

iii.      GODefinition selected in step 5.3 – 5.5 show up

 

7.       For each GODefinition, set 1 TC

8.       Click Done

9.       Change permission

1)      Click “Permission…” button

2)      Click “Goals”

3)      Check “New Group Goal Creation”

4)      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

5)      Uncheck all permissions for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

6)      Uncheck all permissions for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

7)      Only check create/insert/correct/delete for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4

8)      Click “Done” button

10.   Click “Edit Granting”

[Verify]

iv.     Section “2: Specify the target population whom the above granted users have permission to access.” Shows up

v.       Section “3: Specify the target population for the other objects.” Shows up

a.       Only GODefinition created in pre-condition step4 shows up

b.      TC selected in step 7 should be there

 

11.   Select “Everyone” for target population

12.   Click Done

13.   Click “Add…” button to add a new rule

 [Verify]

vi.     Section “2: Specify the target population whom the above granted users have permission to access.” Shows up

vii.    Section “3: Specify the target population for the other objects.” Shows up

a.       Only GODefinition created in pre-condition step4 shows up

 

14.   Click cancel

15.   Click save changes

[Verify]

viii.  In DB, only one record

ix.     obj_def_external_code = <object definition created in pre-condition step4>

x.       field_external_code = <field external code selected in step7 for object definition created in pre-condition step4>

xi.     sf_field2 = operator selected in step7 for object definition created in pre-condition step4

xii.    sf_field3 = value selected in step7 for object definition created in pre-condition step4

 

SQL:

select rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, obj_def.external_code, field_def.external_code, tc_detail.sf_field2, tc_detail.sf_field3

  from sfmain_aceqa88.rbp_perm_role

  left join sfmain_aceqa88.rbp_perm_rule on rbp_perm_role.role_id = rbp_perm_rule.role_id

  left join sfmain_aceqa88.generic_object_t tc_map on tc_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_rule.rule_id)

  left join sfmain_aceqa88.generic_object_t tc on tc.parent_row_id = tc_map.row_id

  left join sfmain_aceqa88.generic_object_t tc_detail on tc_detail.parent_row_id = tc.row_id

  left join sfmain_aceqa88.generic_object_t field_def on to_char(field_def.internal_id) = tc_detail.sf_field1

  left join sfmain_aceqa88.generic_object_t obj_def on field_def.parent_row_id = obj_def.row_id

  where role_name = '<role name>' and tc_map.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaMap'

 

16.   Edit the same role

17.   Click edit granting

[Verify]

xiii.  Section “2: Specify the target population whom the above granted users have permission to access.” Shows up

xiv.  Section “3: Specify the target population for the other objects.” Shows up

a.       Only GODefinition created in pre-condition step4 shows up

 

18.   Click cancel

19.   Change permission

1)      Click “Permission…” button

2)      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

3)      Check all permissions for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

4)      Uncheck all permissions for GODefinition created in pre-condition step4

5)      Click “Done” button

20.   Click edit granting

[Verify]

xv.   Section “2: Specify the target population whom the above granted users have permission to access.” Shows up

xvi.  Section “3: Specify the target population for the other objects.” Shows up

a.       Only GODefinition created in pre-condition step2 shows up

b.      All is selected

 

21.   Set 1 TC

22.   Click done

23.   Click save changes

[Verify]

xvii.In DB, only one record

xviii.           obj_def_external_code = <object definition created in pre-condition step2>

xix.  field_external_code = <field external code selected in step21 for object definition created in pre-condition step2>

xx.   sf_field2 = operator selected in step21 for object definition created in pre-condition step2

xxi.  sf_field3 = value selected in step21 for object definition created in pre-condition step2

 

24.   Edit the same role

25.   Click edit granting

[Verify]

xxii.Section “2: Specify the target population whom the above granted users have permission to access.” Shows up

xxiii.           Section “3: Specify the target population for the other objects.” Shows up

a.       Only GODefinition created in pre-condition step2 shows up

 

26.   Click cancel

27.   Change permission

1)      Click “Permission…” button

2)      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

3)      UnCheck all permissions for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

4)      Click “Done” button

28.   Click edit granting

[Verify]

xxiv.          Section “2: Specify the target population whom the above granted users have permission to access.” Shows up

xxv.            Section “Specify the target population for the other objects.” Does NOT show up

a.       No GODefintion shows up

 

29.   Click done

30.   Click save changes

[Verify]

xxvi.          In DB, no record

 

31.   Edit the same role

32.   Change permission

1)      Click “Permission…” button

2)      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

3)      Check all permissions for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

4)      Click “Done” button

33.   Add a TC

1)      Click Edit Granting

2)      Set a TC for GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

3)      Click done

34.   Click save changes

35.   Go to Configure GO Definition page

36.   Delete the GODefinition created in pre-condition step3

37.   Edit the same role

38.   Click Edit Granting

[Verify]

xxvii.         Section “2: Specify the target population whom the above granted users have permission to access.” Shows up

xxviii.       Section “Specify the target population for the other objects.” Does NOT show up

a.       No GODefintion shows up

 

39.   Click done

40.   Click save changes

[Verify]

xxix.          In DB, no record

testcase.name: Should hide transient field in target criteria in RBP configuration page
testcase.summary: Transient field in target criteria in RBP configuration page should not be displayed ,and in field Level Overrides still can find the transient field

step.actions: 1.Create one definition GO1,add all  data types fields.  For each field, in  detail tab ,set 'isTransient' as 'Yes'. Set Security as 'Yes',permission Category as 'Miscellaneous Permissions'
Create one new role, add view and edit permission for GO1 in Miscellaneous Permissions
step.expectedresults: All the fields including the transient fields can be displayed in the dropdown list of Check  field Level Overrides

step.actions: Click add button in 'Grant this role to ..' subwindow-->Choose 'Restrict target population to' for GO1-->Click the dropdown list
step.expectedresults: Only externalCode and externalName can be found, all the fields which are transient field can not be found.

step.actions: Correct GO1 definition,update all the fields to set 'isTransient' as 'No'
Refresh the role, check the dropdown list again
step.expectedresults: All the fields excepted date type, datetime, time, attachment, clob, Translatable fields should be listed.

testcase.name: DateTimeField
testcase.summary:
Make sure 

1. DateTime typed field is not showing up in TC
2. Support field override
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create an object definition (code = TestDateTime, effectiveDating = None), and add a field (name = DateTimeField, type = DateTime)

2. Create an object instance (externalCode = Obj1, DateTimeField = 1/1/2000 8:00:00

3. Update the definition and set Secured = Yes

step.actions:
Create a RBP role

Check Edit permission 

Check Field Level Overrides

Select DateTimeField = Read Only

Click Done

Add a new rule

Choose Everyone in access group

Choose "Restrict target population to:"
step.expectedresults: Verify "DateTimeField" not existing in the field list

testcase.name: Same fields in Target Criteria should be all correctly saved
testcase.summary: Same fields of a single GODefinition with different values should be all correctly saved.
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Login as a user has permission of generic object

2.      Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = None

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

4)      Add a field named field1

step.actions:
1.      Login as a user has permission ” Manage Role-Based Permission Access”

2.      Create a new role

3.      Click “Permission…” button to add object permissions for GODefinition

1)      Click “Permission…” button

2)      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”

3)      Check view for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

4)      Click done

4.      Click Add button

5.      Select Managers in access group

6.      Select “Restrict target population to:” for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

7.      Set a TC as  field1 = value1

8.      Set another TC as field1 = value2

9.      Click done button

10.   Click save changes button

[Verify]

                 i.         In DB, only 1 rule_id for 2 records with same tc_field = field1 and different tc_value values(value1, value2)

 

 

 

       SQL:

 

select rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, obj_def.external_code obj_def_external_code, tc.sf_field2 restriction, tc_detail.sf_field4 tc_field, tc_detail.sf_field2 tc_operator, tc_detail.sf_field3 tc_value
  from sfqa4_zsystem01.rbp_perm_role
 left  join sfqa4_zsystem01.rbp_perm_rule on rbp_perm_role.role_id = rbp_perm_rule.role_id
  left join sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t tc_map on tc_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_rule.rule_id)
  left join sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t tc on tc.parent_row_id = tc_map.row_id
  left join sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t tc_detail on tc_detail.parent_row_id = tc.row_id
  left join sfqa4_zsystem01.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_def.internal_id = tc.sf_field1
  where role_name = '<role name>' and tc_map.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaMap'

  order by rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, obj_def.external_code

 

 

11.   Edit the role saved in step 10

12.   Click edit granting

[Verify]

                ii.          TC are same as step 7 and step 8

testcase.name: Auto-completion behavior
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Login as a user has permission of generic object

2.       Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Basic

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

4)      different field types (Picklist, GO, FO - jobCode)

3.       Create 9 options for the picklist defined in pre-condition step2.4)

4.       Create 1 options for other picklist

5.       Create 9 instances for the GO defined in pre-condition step2.4)

6.       Create 1 instances for other GODeifinition

7.       Create 9 Job Classifications

1)      Go to Admin Tools

2)      Click Manage Organization, Pay and Job Structures

3)      Select Job Classification in create new

4)      Enter Job Code and Job Title, select active in status and click save

8.       Create 1 Work Flow (similar steps as pre-condition step7)

step.actions:
1.       Login as a user has permission “Manage Role-Based Permission Access”

2.       Create a new role

3.       Click “Permission…” button to add object permissions for GODefinition

1)      Check view for GODefinition created in pre-condition step2

2)      Click done

4.       Click Add button

5.       Select Everyone in access group

6.       Select PickList field in target criteria

[Verify]

i.      Click dropdown will return all 9 options created in pre-condition step3

ii.     Click dropdown will not return option created in pre-condition step4

iii.    Type text in auto-completion will search out correct result

iv.    Search external_code and name should be working, result shows external_code and name

 

7.       Select a value (value1)

8.       In last row, select PickList field in target criteria and select another value (value2)

9.       In last row, select GO field in target criteria

[Verify]

v.     Click dropdown will return all 9 instances created in pre-condition step5

vi.    Click dropdown will not return instance created in pre-condition step6

vii.   Type text in auto-completion will search out correct result

viii.  Search external_code and name should be working, result shows external_code and name

 

10.   Select a value (value1)

11.   In last row, select GO field in target criteria and select another value (value2)

12.   In last row, select FO field in target criteria

[Verify]

ix.    Click dropdown will return all 9 instances created in pre-condition step7

x.     Click dropdown will not return instance created in pre-condition step8

xi.    Type text in auto-completion will search out correct result

2)      externalCode: label = ExternalCodeEn and add translation for zh_CN = ExternalCode中文

7.       Create an object definition (Root) with

select rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, obj_def.external_code obj_def_external_code, field_def.external_code field_external_code, tc_detail.sf_field2, tc_detail.sf_field3, tc_detail.sf_field4

  from sfqa4_zsystem01.rbp_perm_role

testcase.name: Different data types of field in reference/child object
testcase.summary:
Please note we cannot add custom Enum typed field.

We can create the object definition, without EnumField. Then edit the definition and make field "mdfSystemStatus" editable
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object, Foundation Object in Provisioning

{C}2.       Create a picklist (testingPicklist) with options

{C}1)      Option1

{C}2)      Option2

{C}5.       Create 2 Workflow instances (WF1, WF2)

{C}6.       Create an object definition (ReferenceGO) with fields

{C}1)      StringField: type = String

{C}2)      NumberField: type = Number

{C}3)      DecimalField: type = Decimal

{C}4)      BooleanField: type = Boolean

{C}5)      DateField: type = Date

{C}6)      PicklistField: type = Picklist; Valid Values Source = testingPicklist

{C}7)      TranslatebleField: type = Translateble

{C}8)      DataSourceField: type = Data Source; Valid Values Source = rbpCategoryDataSource

{C}9)      EnumField: type = Enum; Valid Values Source = com.successfactors.fo.bean.eo.StatusEnum

{C}10)   GOField: type = GO; Valid Values Source = FieldGO

{C}11)   FOField: type = FO; Valid Values Source = wfConfig

{C}12)   UserField: type = User

{C}13)   InvisibleField: type = String; Visibility = Not Visible

{C}7.       Create 2 object instances of definition in step6

{C}8.       Create an object definition (CompositeChild) with fields (same as step6)

{C}9.       Create an object definition (ValidWhenChild) with fields (same as step6)

{C}10.   Create 2 object instances of definition in step9 (vw1, vw2)

{C}11.   Create an object definition (RootObjWithReference) with fields

{C}1)      RefField: type = GO; Valid Values Source = ReferenceGO

{C}2)      Security: Secured = Yes

{C}12.   Create an object definition (RootObjWithComp) with fields

{C}1)      Association: Name = Comp; Type = Composite; Multiplicity = One To Many; Destination Object = CompositeChild

{C}2)      Security: Secured = Yes

{C}13.   Create an object instance of definition in step12 with 2 composite child (comp1, comp2)

{C}14.   Create an object definition (RootObjWithVW) with fields

{C}1)      Association: Name = VW; Type = Valid When; Multiplicity = One To One; Destination Object = ValidWhenChild

{C}2)      Security: Secured = Yes

testcase.name: Legacy data support
testcase.summary:
Befor b1305 internal id of field is saved in SF_FIELD1 for target criteria.
After b1305 dot expression is saved in SF_FIELD4 for target criteria.

This case is to make sure old data is able to be displayed and edited
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object in Provisioning
2.       Create an object definition (PLT9887Def) with fields
1)      StringField: type = String; Label = StringFieldLabel
2)      FOField: type = FO; data source = wfConfig; Label = FOFieldLabel
3)      Security: Secured = Yes
3.       Create 2 workflow instance (WF1, WF2)
4.       Create a RBP role
1)      Check view permission of PLT9887Def
2)      Select "Restrict target population to:"
3)      Set a target criteria: StringFieldLabel = String1
4)      Save role
5.       Run SQL to put data into SF_FIELD1, and clear SF_FIELD4
update sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t detail
  set
    sf_field1 = (
    select field_def.internal_id from sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t field_def
      join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_def.row_id = field_def.parent_row_id
      where field_def.external_code = 'StringField' and obj_def.external_code = 'PLT9887Def'
    ),
    sf_field4 = null
  where detail.parent_row_id = (
    select tc.row_id
      from sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_role
      left join sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_rule on rbp_perm_role.role_id = rbp_perm_rule.role_id
      left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc_map on tc_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_rule.rule_id)
      left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc on tc.parent_row_id = tc_map.row_id
      where role_name = '<RoleName>' and tc_map.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaMap'
    )

step.actions:
1.       Edit the RBP role created in Pre-condition step4
2.       Edit the rule
 [Verify]
                              i.      Target criteria is StringFieldLabel = String1
3.       Update target criteria to FOFieldLabel = WF1
[Verify]
                            ii.      Target criteria can be changed to FOFieldLabel = WF1
4.       Save the role
[Verify]
                           iii.      In DB, only 1 record SF_FIELD1 = null, SF_FIELD2 = 'EQUALS', SF_FIELD3 = '<internal_id of WF1>', SF_FIELD4 = 'FOField'
SQL:
select rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, tc.row_id tc_row_id, obj_def.external_code obj_def_external_code, tc.sf_field2 restrictedTC, tc_detail.row_id detail_row_id, tc_detail.sf_field1, field_def.external_code field_external_code, tc_detail.sf_field2, tc_detail.sf_field3
  , tc_detail.sf_field4
  from sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_role
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_rule on rbp_perm_role.role_id = rbp_perm_rule.role_id
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc_map on tc_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_rule.rule_id)
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc on tc.parent_row_id = tc_map.row_id
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc_detail on tc_detail.parent_row_id = tc.row_id
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t field_def on to_char(field_def.internal_id) = tc_detail.sf_field1
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_def.internal_id = tc.sf_field1
  where role_name = '<RoleName>' and tc_map.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaMap'
  order by rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, obj_def.external_code, field_def.external_code 
5.       Edit the same RBP role and rule
 [Verify]
                          iv.      Target criteria is FOFieldLabel = WF1
6.       Cancel
7.       Run SQL to put data into SF_FIELD1, and clear SF_FIELD4
update sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t detail
  set
    sf_field1 = (
    select field_def.internal_id from sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t field_def
      join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_def.row_id = field_def.parent_row_id
      where field_def.external_code = 'FOField' and obj_def.external_code = 'PLT9887Def'
    ),
    sf_field4 = null
  where detail.parent_row_id = (
    select tc.row_id
      from sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_role
      left join sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_rule on rbp_perm_role.role_id = rbp_perm_rule.role_id
      left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc_map on tc_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_rule.rule_id)
      left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc on tc.parent_row_id = tc_map.row_id
      where role_name = '<RoleName>' and tc_map.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaMap'
    )
8.       Edit the same RBP role and rule
 [Verify]
                            v.      Target criteria is FOFieldLabel = WF1
9.       Change value to WF2
 [Verify]
                          vi.      Target criteria can be changed to FOFieldLabel = WF2
10.   Save the role
[Verify]
                         vii.      In DB, only 1 record SF_FIELD1 = null, SF_FIELD2 = 'EQUALS', SF_FIELD3 = '<internal_id of WF2>', SF_FIELD4 = 'FOField'
SQL:
select rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, tc.row_id tc_row_id, obj_def.external_code obj_def_external_code, tc.sf_field2 restrictedTC, tc_detail.row_id detail_row_id, tc_detail.sf_field1, field_def.external_code field_external_code, tc_detail.sf_field2, tc_detail.sf_field3
  , tc_detail.sf_field4
  from sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_role
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_rule on rbp_perm_role.role_id = rbp_perm_rule.role_id
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc_map on tc_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_rule.rule_id)
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc on tc.parent_row_id = tc_map.row_id
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t tc_detail on tc_detail.parent_row_id = tc.row_id
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t field_def on to_char(field_def.internal_id) = tc_detail.sf_field1
  left join sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_def.internal_id = tc.sf_field1
  where role_name = '<RoleName>' and tc_map.object_type = 'MDFTargetCriteriaMap'
  order by rbp_perm_rule.rule_id, obj_def.external_code, field_def.external_code

testcase.name: basic in/not in function for string,num,decimal,autonumber and datasource
testcase.preconditions:
1.Go to GO page ,admin center. 

2.Create a none type definition with external code: BasicFunc

 and field name:"string" with string datatype;

           "num"with number datatype;

           "decimal"with deciaml datatype;

           "datasource"with datasource datatype and datasource value is :rbpCategoryDataSource

           "auto"with autonumber datatype  

  secured: yes; Permission Category:Miscellaneous Permissions

step.actions:
Go to manage permission role page,create two roles,file in the role names:TP1,TP2.

grant the permission to everyone.

give all the permission to the definition: BasicFunc

create instance for BasicFunc:

 external code: Func1&Func2

 stringField: abc&d

 numberField: 12&34

 decimalField:1.5&1.20

 datasourceField: MDF Foundation Objects&SAP System Configuration
step.expectedresults: there are two autonumbers appearing after saved: auto1,auto2

step.actions:
In TP1, restrict

stringfield to:in abc

In TP2,restrict stringfield to:not in d

save changes

Go to manage data page
step.expectedresults: Only Func1 can be viewed.

step.actions:
delete the restriction in step2

restrict numField to:in 34 for TP1&not in 13 for TP2

save changes

Go to manage data page
step.expectedresults: both Func1 Func2 can be viewed

step.actions:
delete the restriction in step3

restrict decimalField to:in 1.5 in TP1&notin 1.40 for TP2

save changes

Go to manage data page
step.expectedresults: Both Func1 and Func2 can be viewed.

step.actions:
delete the restriction in step4

restrict datasourceField to:in MDF Foundation Objects for TP1&not in SAP System configuration for TP2

Note: Value of datasourceField should be same as in DB.

save changes

Go to manage data page
step.expectedresults: only Func1 can be viewed.

step.actions:
delet the restriction in step5

restrict autoField to:in auto1 for TP1 & not in auto2 for TP2

save changes

go to the manage data page
step.expectedresults: Only Func1 can be viewed.

testcase.name: RBP_Create_TC_Null_NotNull
testcase.preconditions:

Field:
--cust_stringF, STRING type.
--cust_foF, location, FO type.
Asso:
--cust_vw, 1:M, cust_11660VW, Valid When.
3. Create a role 11660Role, grant View/Create permission to cust_11660VW, grant to everyone.
4. Create a role 11660Role, grant Edit/view permission to cust_None11660, grant to everyone.

1. Create a MCPD type GOD cust_11660VW, secured = Yes
2. Create a NONE type GOD cust_Basic11660, secured = Yes
Field:
--cust_stringF, STRING type.
--cust_foF, location, FO type.
Asso:
--cust_vw, 1:M, cust_11660VW, Valid When.
3. Create a role 11660Role, grant View/Create permission to cust_11660VW, grant to everyone.
4. Create a role 11660Role, grant View/Create permission to cust_Basic11660, grant to everyone.

step.actions: 1. In role 11660Role, set TC for cust_None11660, externalName is null
2. Go to manange data page, create a instance for cust_None11660, externalName is empty
step.expectedresults: Instance will be created successfully.

step.actions: 3. Go to manange data page, create a instance for cust_None11660, externalName is abc

step.actions: 4. In role 11660Role, set TC for cust_None11660, externalName is not null
5. Go to manange data page, create a instance for cust_None11660, externalName = abc

step.actions: 6. Go to manange data page, create a instance for cust_None11660, externalName is empty
step.expectedresults: Instance will be created successfully.

step.actions: 7. Rerun step1 to step7 for cust_Basic11660.

2)      Add fields with all primitive dataType and all non-primitive dataType(GO/Picklist/FO)

3)      securedByRBP = Yes

4)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

       3.      Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = MCPD

2)      Add fields with all primitive dataType and all non-primitive dataType(GO/Picklist/FO)

2.      Click “Permission…”.

5.      Click the Field dropdown of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1.

6.      Click the Permission dropdown of the GODefinition created in prec-condition step1.

7.      Click the Field dropdown of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step2.

                                 vii.          All fields show in the Field dropdown, including empty value, externalCode, externalName, effectivStartDate, fields added in pre-conditon step3.2.

10.   Click the Permission dropdown of the GODefinition created in pre-condition step3.

[Verify]

                                viii.          Have three options (empty value, No Access and Read Only).

testcase.name: Automatically add a new field override permission row once change the value of last row.
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = None

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

2.      Create a role and check view permission for the GODefinition created in step1.

step.actions:
1.      Edit the role created in pre-condition step2.

2.      Click “Permission…”.

3.      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”.

4.      Check Field Level Overrides checkbox.

5.      Add a field override  permission.

[Verify]

                                     i.          A trash can icon added at the end of the previous row.

                                    ii.          A new field override added below the previous one without a trash can icon.

                                   iii.          Values in both field and permission dropdown of the last row are empty.

6.      Change the value of the empty row added in step5.ii

[Verify]

                                   iv.          A trash can icon added at the end of the previous row.

                                    v.          A new field override added below the previous one without a trash can icon.

                                   vi.          Values in both field and permission dropdown of the last row are empty.

 

7.      Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Basic

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

8.      Repeat pre-condition step2 and step1-6

 

9.      Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = MCPD

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

10.   Repeat pre-condition step2 and step1-6

testcase.name: Delete field override permission.
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = None

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

2.      Create a role and check view permission for the GODefinition created in step1.

3.      Edit the role created in step2.

1)      Add two field override permissions for the GODefinition created in pre-condition step1.

1st : externalCode = Read Only

2nd : externalName = No Access

step.actions:
1.      Edit the role edited in pre-condition step3.

2.      Click “Permission…”.

3.      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”.

4.      Delete the 2nd field override permission added in pre-condition step3.

[Verify]

                                     i.          The 2nd field override permission row disappears.

5.      Click done button.

6.      Click save changes button.

7.      Check DB

[Verify]

                                    ii.          Only the 1st field override permission added in pre-condition step3.

SQL:

select rbp_perm_role.role_id, obj_def.external_code, obj_perm.sf_field1 view_perm, obj_perm.sf_field2 edit_perm,

 obj_perm.sf_field3 view_cur, obj_perm.sf_field4 view_his, obj_perm.sf_field5 create_perm, obj_perm.sf_field6 insert_perm, obj_perm.sf_field7 correct_perm, obj_perm.sf_field8 delete_perm,

    obj_perm.sf_field9 field_override, filed_def.external_code field_ext_code, field_override.sf_field1 field_permission

    from sfqa4_zjdm.rbp_perm_role

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t role_obj_perm_map on role_obj_perm_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_role.role_id)

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t obj_perm on role_obj_perm_map.row_id = obj_perm.parent_row_id

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_perm.external_code = to_char(obj_def.internal_id)

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t field_override on obj_perm.row_id = field_override.parent_row_id

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t filed_def on filed_def.internal_id = field_override.external_code

   where role_name = '<role name>' and role_obj_perm_map.object_type = 'RBPRoleObjectPermissionMap' and obj_def.external_code = '<external_code of GODefinition>'

 

8.      Edit the role saved in step6.

9.      Click “Permission…”.

10.   Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”.

[Verify]

                                   iii.          Only the 1st field override permission shows.

11.   Delete the 1st field override permission added in pre-condition step3.

[Verify]

                                   iv.          The 1st field override permission row disappears.

12.   Click done button.

13.   Click save changes button.

14.   Check DB

[Verify]

                                    v.          Only one record in DB with field_override = false, field_ext_code = null, field_permission = null.

SQL:

Same as above.

15.   Edit the role save in step13.

16.   Click “Permission…”.

17.   Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”.

[Verify]

                                   vi.          No field override permission shows.

                                 vii.          The Field Level Overrides checkbox default to uncheck.

 

18.   Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Basic

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

19.   Repeat pre-condition step2-3 and step1-17

 

20.   Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = MCPD

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

21.   Repeat pre-condition step2-3 and step1-17

testcase.name: Empty field override permission will make field level overrides checkbox go back to uncheck.
testcase.preconditions:
1.      Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = None

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions.

2.      Create a role and check view permission for the GODefinition created in step1.

step.actions:
1.      Edit the role created in pre-condition step2.

2.      Click “Permission…”.

3.      Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”.

4.      Check Field Level Overrides checkbox.

5.      Click done button.

6.      Click save changes button.

7.      Check DB

[Verify]

                                     i.          One record in DB with field_override = false

SQL:

select rbp_perm_role.role_id, obj_def.external_code, obj_perm.sf_field1 view_perm, obj_perm.sf_field2 edit_perm,

 obj_perm.sf_field3 view_cur, obj_perm.sf_field4 view_his, obj_perm.sf_field5 create_perm, obj_perm.sf_field6 insert_perm, obj_perm.sf_field7 correct_perm, obj_perm.sf_field8 delete_perm,

    obj_perm.sf_field9 field_override, filed_def.external_code field_ext_code, field_override.sf_field1 field_permission

    from sfqa4_zjdm.rbp_perm_role

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t role_obj_perm_map on role_obj_perm_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_role.role_id)

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t obj_perm on role_obj_perm_map.row_id = obj_perm.parent_row_id

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_perm.external_code = to_char(obj_def.internal_id)

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t field_override on obj_perm.row_id = field_override.parent_row_id

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t filed_def on filed_def.internal_id = field_override.external_code

   where role_name = '<role name>' and role_obj_perm_map.object_type = 'RBPRoleObjectPermissionMap' and obj_def.external_code = '<external_code of GODefinition>'

 

8.      Edit the role saved in step6.

9.      Click “Permission…”.

10.   Click “Miscellaneous Permissions”.

[Verify]

                                     i.          The field level overrides checkbox checked in step4 goes back to uncheck.

 

11.   Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = Basic

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

12.   Repeat pre-condition step2 and step1-9

 

13.   Create a GODefinition with

1)      effectiveDating = MCPD

2)      securedByRBP = Yes

3)      permissionCategory = Miscellaneous Permissions

14.   Repeat pre-condition step2 and step1-9

37.   Repeat pre-condition step2 and step1-33

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t role_obj_perm_map on role_obj_perm_map.external_code = to_char(rbp_perm_role.role_id)

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t obj_perm on role_obj_perm_map.row_id = obj_perm.parent_row_id

    left join sfqa4_zjdm.generic_object_t obj_def on obj_perm.external_code = to_char(obj_def.internal_id)

testcase.name: Data type should be stored in DB along with field override
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object, Foundation Object in Provisioning

2.       Create a picklist (PLT12885Picklist) with options
1)      Option1
2)      Option2
3.       Create an object definition (PLT12885FieldGO)
4.       Create an object definition (PLT12885Root) with fields
1)      StringField: type = String
2)      NumberField: type = Number
3)      DecimalField: type = Decimal
4)      BooleanField: type = Boolean
5)      DateField: type = Date
6)      PicklistField: type = Picklist; Valid Values Source = PLT12885Picklist
7)      TranslatableField: type = Translatable
8)      DataSourceField: type = Data Source; Valid Values Source = rbpCategoryDataSource
9)      EnumField: type = Enum; Valid Values Source = com.successfactors.fo.bean.eo.StatusEnum
10)   GOField: type = GO; Valid Values Source = PLT12885FieldGO
11)   FOField: type = FO; Valid Values Source = wfConfig
12)   UserField: type = User
13)   AutoNumberField: type = Auto Number
14)   Security: Secured = Yes; permission category = miscellaneous

step.actions:
1.       Login with a user with RBP permission
2.       Create a RBP role
3.       In miscellaneous, check view permission of PLT12885Root and check field override
4.       Configure field override as

NO_ACCESS

NO_ACCESS

NO_ACCESS

NO_ACCESS

NO_ACCESS
PicklistField
NO_ACCESS

NO_ACCESS

NO_ACCESS

NO_ACCESS
AutoNumberField
NO_ACCESS
5.       Click done
6.       Create a new rule, select everyone in access group
7.       Save changes
[Verify in DB]
                              i.      Below values are correct
EXTERNAL_CODE
OVERRIDE_TYPE

STRING

NUMBER

DECIMAL

BOOLEAN

LOCALIZED

ENUM

GO

FO
UserField
USER
AutoNumberField
AUTO_NUMBER
 
SELECT rbp_perm_role.role_id,
obj_perm.sf_field9 field_override,
filed_def.external_code external_code,
field_override.sf_field1 field_permission,
field_override.sf_field2 override_type
FROM sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_role
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t role_obj_perm_map
ON role_obj_perm_map.external_code = TO_CHAR(rbp_perm_role.role_id) and role_obj_perm_map.object_type = 'RBPRoleObjectPermissionMap'
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t obj_perm
ON role_obj_perm_map.row_id = obj_perm.parent_row_id and obj_perm.object_type = 'RBPObjectPermission'
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t obj_def
ON obj_perm.external_code = TO_CHAR(obj_def.internal_id) and (obj_def.object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition')
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t field_override
ON obj_perm.row_id = field_override.parent_row_id and field_override.object_type = 'RBPFieldOverride'
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t filed_def
ON filed_def.internal_id = field_override.external_code and (filed_def.object_type = 'GOFieldDefinition' or filed_def.object_type = 'GOAssociationDefinition')
WHERE role_name = '<role name>'
AND role_obj_perm_map.object_type = 'RBPRoleObjectPermissionMap'
AND obj_def.external_code = '<object definition>'

testcase.name: Composite child level permission showing label
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object, Foundation Object, check zh_CN language in Provisioning
2.       Create an object definition PLT13125CompChildDef
1)      Label PLT13125CompChildDefEn
2)      Label for zh_CN: PLT13125CompChildDef中文
3)      Security: Secured = Yes; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
3.       Create an object definition PLT13125RootDef
1)      Label PLT13125RootDefEn
2)      Label for zh_CN: PLT13125RootDef中文
3)      Association: name = CompAsso; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13125CompChildDef; Label = CompAssoEn; Label for zh_CN = CompAsso中文

step.actions:
1.       Login as a user whose local is en_US with RBP permission
2.       Create a RBP role
3.       In miscellaneous
 [Verify]
                              i.      PLT13125RootDefEn.CompAssoEn (PLT13125CompChildDefEn) shows up
                            ii.      Permission setting for PLT13125RootDefEn doesn’t show up
 
4.       Login as a user whose local is zh_CN with RBP permission
5.       Create a RBP role
6.       In miscellaneous
 [Verify]
                              i.      PLT13125RootDef中文.CompAsso中文 (PLT13125CompChildDef中文) shows up

testcase.name: Composite child level permission field override
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object, Foundation Object, check zh_CN language in Provisioning
2.       Create an object definition PLT13126CompGrandChildDef
3.       Create an object definition PLT13126CompChildDef
1)      Add a field: field1; label for en_US = field1En; label for zh_CN = field1中文
2)      Association: name = CompChildAsso; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13126CompGrandChildDef; Label for en_US = CompChildAssoEn; Label for zh_CN = CompChildAsso中文
3)      Security: Secured = Yes; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
4.       Create an object definition PLT13126RootDef
1)      Association: name = CompAsso; type = composite; Multiplicity = one to one; destination object = PLT13126CompChildDef

step.actions:
1.       Login with a user with RBP permission
2.       Create a RBP role
3.       In miscellaneous, check view permission of PLT13126RootDef.CompAsso
4.       Check Field Level Overrides
5.       Select field override:
1)      CompChildAssoEn: No Access
2)      field1En: No Access
6.       Click done
7.       Add a rule, access group: everyone, target criteria: all
8.       Save changes.
[Verify In DB]
                              i.      Only 2 records
                            ii.      FIELD_OVERRIDE = true; EXTERNAL_CODE = CompChildAsso; FIELD_PERMISSION = NO_ACCESS; OVERRIDE_TYPE = COMPOSITE
                           iii.      FIELD_OVERRIDE = true; EXTERNAL_CODE = field1; FIELD_PERMISSION = NO_ACCESS; OVERRIDE_TYPE = String
SQL:
SELECT rbp_perm_role.role_id,
  obj_perm.sf_field9 field_override,
  filed_def.external_code external_code,
  field_override.sf_field1 field_permission,
  field_override.sf_field2 override_type
FROM sfqa4_zsystem03.rbp_perm_role
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t role_obj_perm_map
ON role_obj_perm_map.external_code = TO_CHAR(rbp_perm_role.role_id) and role_obj_perm_map.object_type = 'RBPRoleObjectPermissionMap'
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t obj_perm
ON role_obj_perm_map.row_id = obj_perm.parent_row_id and obj_perm.object_type = 'RBPObjectPermission'
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t obj_def
ON obj_perm.external_code = TO_CHAR(obj_def.internal_id) and (obj_def.object_type = 'GOObjectDefinition')
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t field_override
ON obj_perm.row_id = field_override.parent_row_id and field_override.object_type = 'RBPFieldOverride'
LEFT JOIN sfqa4_zsystem03.generic_object_t filed_def 
ON filed_def.internal_id          = field_override.external_code and (filed_def.object_type = 'GOFieldDefinition' or filed_def.object_type = 'GOAssociationDefinition')
WHERE role_name                   = '<role name>'
AND role_obj_perm_map.object_type = 'RBPRoleObjectPermissionMap'
AND obj_def.external_code         = '<object definition>'
 
9.       Edit the same role, click permission button and click misc permission link
[Verify]
                              i.      Field override set in step 5 is correctly displayed
10.   Remove “field1En: No Access” in field override
11.   Change “CompChildAssoEn” to “Read Only” in field override
12.   Click done
13.   click permission button and click misc permission link
14.   Remove “CompChildAssoEn: Read Only”
15.   Click cancel button.
16.   Click save changes.
17.   Edit the same role, click permission button and click misc permission link
[Verify]
                              i.      Only “field1En: No Access” has been removed
                            ii.      “CompChildAssoEn: Read Only” should be there
18.   Add another row of field override: CompChildAssoEn: No Access
19.   Click done button
[Verify]
                              i.      Alert shows there’s duplicated field override settings
20.   Click cancel button and save changes
21.   Copy the role
[Verify]
                              i.      Role is copied
                            ii.      Copied permissions are correct
22.   Delete the role created in step8
[Verify]
                              i.      The role is deleted
23.   Login a user whose Locale is zh_CN
24.   Edit the role copied in step21, click permission button and click misc permission link
[Verify]
                              i.      CompChildAsso中文: Read Only

testcase.name: Invalid field of a GO cannot be added into dg-filters
testcase.preconditions:
0. Enable en_US, zh_CN language in provisioning

1. Import attached picklist

2. Import attached object definitions(change the FO field from businessUnit to location)

3. Add below entry into <hris-element id="jobInfo"> section of Succession Data Model

    <hris-field max-length="256" id="custom-string1" visibility="both" type="cust_PLT372447Root"> 
      <label>PLT372447Root</label> 
    </hris-field>

4. Add below entry into <hris-element id="businessUnit"> of Corporate Data Model

(change to <hris-element id="location">)

<hris-field max-length="256" id="custom-string2" visibility="both" type="cust_PLT372447Root"> 
     <label>PLT372447Root</label> 
</hris-field> 
<hris-associations>
    <association id="id" multiplicity="ONE_TO_MANY" destination-entity="cust_PLT372447Root" />
</hris-associations>

step.actions:
//Test non-exist field

Add below entry into <permission-group-filter> section of Succession Data Model

<hris-element-ref refid="jobInfo">
    <hris-field-ref refid="custom-string1" ref-field = "cust_StringField1"/>
</hris-element-ref>

testcase.summary:
This case needs EC data (EMP_JOB_INFO_T related tables)

Data has been configured in QACANDRot/zSystem01J/admin/pwd

If you use this instance for testing, please don't change any data in FO, GO, EMP_JOB_INFO_T

Preconditions please refer to PLT#-123466027
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create 4 FOs - Business Unit: BU1, BU2, BU3, BU4 with effeciveStartDate = 1/1/1900
  2. Import attached picklist
  3. Import attached definitions
  4. Import attached object instances
  5. Import attached CDM
  6. Import attached SDM
  7. Update Business Units
    1. Update BU1 set PLT372447Root = Root2
    2. Update BU2 set PLT372447Root = Root1
    3. Update BU3 set PLT372447Root = Root3
    4. Update BU4 set PLT372447Root = Root4
  8. Update users' job info
    1. update <dbSchema>.emp_job_info_t set business_unit = <internal_code of BU2>, custom_varchar1 = <internal_id of Root1> where users_sys_id = 'admin';
    2. update <dbSchema>.emp_job_info_t set business_unit = <internal_code of BU1>, custom_varchar1 = <internal_id of Root2> where users_sys_id = 'mhoff1';
    3. update <dbSchema>.emp_job_info_t set business_unit = <internal_code of BU3>, custom_varchar1 = <internal_id of Root3> where users_sys_id = 'jlo1';
    4. update <dbSchema>.emp_job_info_t set business_unit = <internal_code of BU4>, custom_varchar1 = <internal_id of Root4> where users_sys_id = 'cgrant1';
    5. update <dbSchema>.emp_job_info_t set  custom_varchar1 = <internal_id of Root5> where users_sys_id = 'athompson1';
    6. update <dbSchema>.emp_job_info_t set custom_varchar1 = <internal_id of Root6> where users_sys_id = 'sthomas1';
    7.

step.actions:
• Create dynamic group
  • In the "Choose Group Members" part, choose "Job Information-PLT372447Root-StringField"
step.expectedresults: Only "= (equal to)" operator

step.actions:
• Only put a in value box
  • Only put b in value box
  • Only put c in value box
  • Only put d in value box
step.expectedresults:
• a, b , c, can get result
  • d cannot get result

step.actions:
• Only put b in the value box
  • Click done button
  • Click update button
  • Click number of active group membership
step.expectedresults:
• After clicking update, number of membership changes to 1
  • After clicking number, shows admin only

step.actions: Repeat above steps with "Job Information-Business Unit-PLT372447Root-StringField"
step.expectedresults: Same verification point.

testcase.name: Refresh framework should work for MDF dg-filter
testcase.summary:
http://jira.successfactors.com/browse/XPI-5325

http://jira.successfactors.com/browse/XAF-12749
testcase.preconditions:
To verify this case, we use instance:zSystem01J admin/pwd.

1. insert into qacandrot_cdcyan2.sys_config values ('REFRESH_FRAMEWORK_LISTENING_ENABLE_KEY', 'REFRESH_CONFIG_TYPE', null, null, null, null, null, null);
2. insert into qacandrot_cdcyan2.sys_config (SYS_CONFIG_KEY,SYS_CONFIG_TYPE,SYS_CONFIG_STRING_VALUE) values ('dgMemberRefresh_forced_enabled', 'REFRESH_CONFIG_TYPE', 'ENABLED'); 
3. insert into qacandrot_cdcyan2.sys_config values ('rbpAGUsrRefresh_forced_enabled', 'REFRESH_CONFIG_TYPE', null, 'ENABLED', null, null, null, null);
4. Enable 'refresh framework' in provisioning

testcase.name: Verify the report detail for User to Role report with all kinds of operators with different fields
testcase.summary:
Proceed to provisioning-> company settings

Enable Ad Hoc Report Builder and tick RBP User to Role Report, RBP Permission to User Report and RBP Permission Roles Report

http://jira.successfactors.com/browse/CRF-1282

step.actions:
Import object definition with adhocReport_1_definition.zip

Import object instance of: adhocReport_go_instance.zip and adhocReport_picklist.zip
step.expectedresults: Import completed without any issue

step.actions:
Create a role "adhocReport_1" for cust_adhocReport_1 and grant all permissions for it.

Create a rule and set Target Criteria for only admin user follow the attached tc1.png

Create a rule and set Target Criteria for only admin user as: decimal=12345.12

Create a rule and set Target Criteria for only cgrant user follow the attached tc2.png

Then save the role

step.expectedresults: Page proceed to Create Role Based Permission: User to Role Report page

Click Columns button and click Select Columns button
step.expectedresults:

step.actions: Click save button to save the report then click Generate button
step.expectedresults: A new page pops with Report displays

step.actions: Click csv button to download the report
step.expectedresults: report can be downloaded normally

step.actions: Check the detail of the report and filter the column of Criteria object name with the cust_adhocReport_1
step.expectedresults:
For user "admin", the role name is "adhocReport_1".

There are two row for admin, the target criteria is:

1. cust_autonum <= 166 , cust_autonum >= 133 , cust_boolean != false , cust_decimal < 123.123 , cust_ds IS NULL  , cust_fo = Shanghai , cust_go != go1, cust_go.cust_f1=333 , cust_num > 123 , cust_picklist IS NOT NULL  , cust_string = aaa , cust_user != admin , mdfSystemStatus = A

2. cust_decimal = 12345.12

For user "cgrant", the role name is "adhocReport_1", the value of Criteria is:

cust_fo NOT IN (Beijing , Shanghai-2) , cust_picklist IN (Option1 , Option2) , cust_user NOT IN (cgrant1 , jlo) , mdfSystemStatus IN (A , I), cust_go.cust_user IN (admin, Larryadmin, superadmin2)

For user "jlo", the role name is "adhocReport_1", the value of Criteria is empty

testcase.name: (Basic) User in the customized access group should have valid permissions for target Person object
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create  a basic definition "cust_Person_GO6" 

    set externalCode as "Generic Object" data type and valid values source "Person".

2. Create intances for "cust_Person_GO6":

     <Person1>: externalCode = Person1 (map to User1)

     <Person2>: externalCode = Person2 (map to User2)

    Note: both User1 and User2 are reported to the same manager (e.g achin1)

3. Enable RBP support: 

      1) Set secured = "Yes" and permission category = "Miscellaneous Permissions"

      2) set RBP Subject User Field = externalCode

4. Create a role for "cust_Person_GO6" :

    Role1: grant all permissions, access group = Manager's group include achin1, admin, target population = "Granted User's Direct Reports";

step.actions: 1. Login as admin and navigate to Manage Data page, search instances <Person1> and <Person2> .
step.expectedresults: Cannot search out both objects

step.actions:
1. Login as achin1 and navigate to Manage Data page, search <Person1> and <Person2> instances.

   verify both instances are searched and displayed with details.

2. For <Person1>

   1) click Take Actions --> Make corrections.

   2) change externalCode to Person3 (map to user which is not directed report to achin1).

     verify "No Permission" error window pops.

   3) keep externalCode as "Person1", update the external_Name and click Save.

     verify the updates displayed.

   4) click Insert New Record and keep all value default. click Save.

      verify the new record inserted.

   5) click Take Actions --Permanently delete entry to delete the new record and click Yes to confirm.

      verify the record deleted.

1. Login as admin and update the role to set the target population with a group which only includes User1 in the direct report. 

2. Proxy to achin1 and navigate to Manage Data page, search <Person1> and <Person2> instances.

    Verify only <Person1> searched out and displayed with details, <Person2> is not searched out.

testcase.name: Basic: View Current Permission
testcase.preconditions:
1.       Enable Generic Object in Provisioning
2.       Create an object definition PLT13208Def
1)      effectiveDating = Basic
2)      externalCode: type = User
3.       Create 2 object instances:
1)      externalCode = <user1>
a)         record1: externalName = Obj1Record1; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/1900
b)         record2: externalName = Obj1Record2; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2099
2)      externalCode = <user2>
a)         record1: externalName = Obj2Record1; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/1900
b)         record2: externalName = Obj2Record2; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/2099
4.       Create a Config UI
1)      Base object = PLT13208Def
2)      Id = PLT13208ConfigUI
5.       Create an Employee Profile Portlet
1)      Go to "Admin Tools" -> "Configure Employee Files", Add New View
2)      DashboardName: PLT13208EPView
3)      Insert Portlet
4)      Create & Add: EMP_SCORECARD_MDF
5)      Portlet Title: PLT13208Portlet
6)      MDF Screen ID: PLT13208ConfigUI
7)      Click save
8)      Click save dashboard
9)      Check show/hide for PLT13208EPView and click save changes
6.       Update the definition PLT13208Def
1)      Security: Secured = Yes; Permission Category = Miscellaneous Permissions
7.       Create a RBP role: PLT13208EPView
1)      Check view permission of PLT13208EPView in Employee Views
2)      Access group = permission group which includes admin
3)      Target group = everyone
8.       Create a RBP role: PLT13208ViewCurrent
1)      Check view current permission of PLT13208Def
2)      Access group = permission group which includes admin
3)      Target group = permission group which includes user1, and user3, excludes user2 and user4

step.actions:
1.       Login as admin

2.       Click employee files

3.       Search and go to <user1>

4.       Click PLT13208EPView

[Verify]

                              i.      PLT13208Portlet shows up with data of PLT13208Def’s <user1> instance

                            ii.      See “externalName = Obj1Record1; effectiveStartDate = 1/1/1900”

                           iii.      Cannot see edit link in this portlet

5.       No Manage link shows on page

Click employee files

 Search and go to <user2>

 Click PLT13208EPView
step.expectedresults: PLT13208Portlet doesn’t show up

step.actions:
Search and go to <user3>

Click PLT13208EPView
step.expectedresults: PLT13208Portlet shows up without data

step.actions:
Search and go to <user4>

 Click PLT13208EPView
step.expectedresults:
PLT13208Portlet doesn’t show up

 

                              i.      PLT13208Portlet doesn’t show up

testcase.name: ConfigUI portlet should always display when record in inactive status
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a user based GO object definition and select secured = yes

2. Create new configUI and select GOD created in step1 as base object

3. In Configure Employee Files page, create a new employee view and add a new MDF portlet. Select configUI screen created in step2 as portlet

4. Create a new permission role and check the new view in Employee View category. In Miscellanous permission category, check all permission for the GOD.

5. Select everyone as access group and target group.

step.actions: Login as user1 and go to employee files page. Open the newly created view.
Create a future-dated record for himself from portlet. Go to manage data and set the record as inactive.
Refresh the portlet page
step.expectedresults: Verify the MDF portlet still displays but the record is invisible

step.actions: Login as user2 and create a current effective record in Employee Files MDF portlet. Go to manage data and set the record as inactive.
Refresh the portlet page
step.expectedresults: Verify the portlet still displays and inactive record also displays in portlet.

testcase.name: ConfigUI portlet should always display when record in pending status
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a user based GO object definition and select secured = yes

2. Select pendingData = Yes and attach a step workflow to the GOD

3. Create new configUI and select GOD created in step1 as base object

4. In Configure Employee Files page, create a new employee view and add a new MDF portlet. Select configUI screen created in step2 as portlet

5. Create a new permission role and check the new view in Employee View category. In Miscellanous permission category, check all permission for the GOD.

6. Select everyone as access group and target group.

step.actions: Login as user1 and go to Employee Files->new created view
Create a future dated record from MDF portlet and click confirm in workflow confirmation window
Refresh the portlet page
step.expectedresults: Verify the portlet still displays and the pending record doesn't show up

step.actions:
Login as user2 and create a current effective record from MDF portlet.

Click confirm button in workflow confirmation window
Refresh the portlet page
step.expectedresults: Verify the portlet still displays and the pending record doesn't show up

testcase.name: PTCH27533- Checking permission for create action on portlet should base on the selected user
testcase.preconditions:
1. create user based entity - basic type - with String and Num field. set Yes for security.

2. create config ui and create employee profile portlet.

3. go to permission role and create following two roles

role1 - Permission = view current/view history/create/insert/correct. No FieldOverride. TC=Mgrs. TP=Direct Report.


role2 - Permission = view current/view history/create/insert/correct. Field Override - String = "No Access", Num = "Read Only". TC=Everyone. TP=Self

role3 - Permission=employee views. TC=Everyone

Verify the field loaded.

Num is visible

step.expectedresults:
String is visible

Num is visible

on create page
