on create page

testcase.name: Basic, View Current only
testcase.summary: CRF-9592
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a basic definition cust_XPI3010_Go.

2. In Manage Data page, create following instances:

    Root1 has two records:

   1)  effectiveStartDate=01/01/1900

   2)  effectiveStartDate=01/01/2099

    Root2 has two records:

   1) effectiveStartDate=01/01/1900

   2) effectiveStartDate=01/01/2099

3. Update definition cust_XPI3010_Go, set secured=Yes, Permission Category= Miscellaneous Permissions

4. Create a RoleA:

    1) check "View Current" only for cust_XPI3010_Go

    2) grant role to Everyone

step.actions:
1. Navigate to "Search Data" page, select "cust_XPI3010_Go" from dropdown list, click Advanced and verify there is no "Search As of", only "Including Inactives" displayed. (not belong to mdf rbp)

2. Search out "cust_XPI3010_Go" from dropdown list and click "Search".

3. Verify the instance and its records displayed as:

   Root1 has 1 record displayed.

   Root2 has 1 reocrd displayed.

1. Click link of "Root1" and verify

    1) there is No "Edit" and "Manage" link. 

    2) the effectiveStartDate is "01/01/1900".

1. In the textbox next to Search dropdown list, fill in "Root2" and click Search.

2. Click link of "Root2" and verify

     1) there is No "Edit" and "Manage" link. 

    2) the effectiveStartDate is "01/01/1900".

testcase.name: Baisc, Create only / Insert (View Current checked default)
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a basic definition cust_XPI3010_Go.

2. In Manage Data page, create following instances:

    Root1 has two records:

   1)  effectiveStartDate=01/01/1900

   2)  effectiveStartDate=01/01/2099

    Root2 has two records:

   1) effectiveStartDate=01/01/1900

   2) effectiveStartDate=01/01/2099

3. Update definition cust_XPI3010_Go, set secured=Yes, Permission Category= Miscellaneous Permissions

4. Create a RoleA:

    1) check "View Current" only for cust_XPI3010_Go

    2) grant role to Everyone

step.actions: 1. Navigate to "Search Data" page, verify "cust_XPI3010_Go" is not displayed in the dropdown list of "Search".

1. Update RoleA to check "Insert" only (View Current will be checked by default).

2. Navigate to "Search Data" page, select "cust_XPI3010_Go" and click Search. Verify:

   Root1 has 1 record displayed.

   Root2 has 1 record displayed.

3. Click link of  "Root1" and verify:

    1) No Manage link. Only Edit link is displayed.

    2) effectiveStartDate is "01/01/1900".

 4.  Click Edit link, and insert a record which is the current date(e.g 11/02/2015). Verify the insert works.

  5.  On Search Data page, search "cust_XPI3010_Go" again, Root1 should show with 1 record which effectiveStartDate is current date.

testcase.name: Basic, Correct (View Current and View History checked default) / Delete (View Current and View Histo
testcase.preconditions:
1. Create a basic definition cust_XPI3010_Go with a string type field cust_f1.

2. In Manage Data page, create following instances:

    Root1 has two records:

   1)  effectiveStartDate=01/01/1900  cust_f1=v1

   2)  effectiveStartDate=01/01/2099  cust_f1=v2

    Root2 has two records:

   1) effectiveStartDate=01/01/1900  cust_f1=v1

   2) effectiveStartDate=01/01/2099  cust_f1=v2

3. Update definition cust_XPI3010_GO, set secured=Yes, Permission Category= Miscellaneous Permissions

4. Create a RoleA:

    1) check "Correct" only for cust_XPI3010_GO

    2) grant role to Everyone

step.actions:
1. Navigate to Search Data page, select cust_XPI3010_Go from dropdown list and click Search.

2. Verify 

    Root1 has 1 record displayed.

    Root2 has 1 record displayed.

3. Click the link of Root1 and verify:

    1) Edit and Manage link are displayed.

    2) effectiveStartDate is 01/01/1900

3. Click Edit link, do not change the date, update the externalName as Root1_Name and click Save.

4. Click Search again and verify on the Search Data page, "externalName" column is updated with "Root1_Name" for the Root1 record.

5. Click link of Root2, click Edit link, set the date as current date (e.g 11/02/2015), leave other field as unchanged and click Save. Verify there will be a "No Permission" message pops up. Click Cancel.

6. Click Manage link. Page is redirected to Manage Data page. Verify there is Take Action -> Make Correction link for each record.

7. Click Take Action --> Make Correction for record "01/01/1900" , update the cust_f1 from v1 to v1_update. Verify update is successful.

8. Click Previous to go back to Search Data page

1. Update the Role permission to grant Delete only(View Current and View History will be checked by default).

2.  On Search Data page, select cust_XPI3010_Go from dropdown list and click Search.

3. Click link of Root1 record and verify only Manage link is displayed.

4. Click Manage link, page is redirected to Manage Data, verify there is a Take Action -->Permanently Delete Entry displayed for each record.

5. Delete the record for "01/01/1900".

6. Click Previous to go back to Search Data page, select cust_XPI3010_Go and search again. Verify only Root2 has a record displayed.

testcase.name: MCPD, All permission (View Current, View History, Create, Insert, Correct and Delete)
testcase.summary:
1. Create a MCPD type definition "cust_XPI3010_MCPD" and add a string field cust_f1.

2. Create instance for this definition with two records:

    externalCode=Root1, externalName=Root1_Name1, effectiveStartDate=01/01/1900, transactionSequence=1, cust_f1=v1;

    externalCode=Root1, externalName=Root1_Name2, effectiveStartDate=01/01/1900, transactionSequence=2, cust_f1=v2

3. Update the definition and set Secured=Yes, Permission Category=Miscellaneous Permissions

4. Create a RoleB:

    1) Check all permissions for cust_XPI3010_MCPD and set Field Override: "externalCode" as Read Only, "externalName" as No Access.

    2) grant role to = permission group which include Admin

    3) Restrict target population to: f1=v1

step.actions:
1. Navigate to Search Data page, select "cust_XPI3010_MCPD" from dropdown list and click Search. Verify there is no record returned.

2. Update the RoleB to check target population as All.

3.  Go back to Search Data page and click Search again. Verify a Root1 record is displayed.

4.  Click the link of Root1 and verify:

     1) Edit and Manage link are displayed.

     2) effectiveStartDate = 01/01/1900, transactionSequence=2, f1=v2;

     3) externalName is not shown.

5. Click insert new record, set the date as 01/01/1900, verify externalCode is Read Only, leave all field as default and click Save.

6. On Search Data page, click Search again. Verify the record displayed is shown as transactionSequence =3.

1. Click the link of Root1. click Manage link. Page is redirected to Manage Data.

2. Insert a new record, set date as current date. Leave other field as default and click Save.

3. Select the record of  "01/01/1900" and transactionSequence=3, click Take Actions --> Permanently Delete Entry. Click Yes to confirm.

4. Click Previous link to go back to Search Data page. Select the definition and click Search again. Verify the record displayed is changed to the new created which effectiveStartDate is current.

testcase.name: None, View only / All permission (View, Edit and FieldOverride)
testcase.summary:
1. Create a None type definition cust_XPI3010_None and add a string field cust_f1.

2. Create two instaces for this definition:

    externalCode=Root1, externalName=Root1_Name, cust_f1=v1;

    externalCode=Root2, externalName=Root2_Name, cust_f1=v2;

3. Update cust_XPI3010_None to set Secured=Yes, Permission Category=Miscellaneous Permissions

4. Create a RoleC:

    1) check "View" permission for cust_XPI3010_None;

    2) grant Everyone with this role.

step.actions:
1. Navigate to Search Data page, select "cust_XPI3010_None" from dropdown and click Search.

    Verify the instance and its records are:

     externalCode              externalName

     Root1                          Root1_Name

     Root2                          Root2_Name

2. Click the link of Root1 and verify No Edit link displayed.

1. Update the Role as:

    1) check "View", "Edit" and set Field Override "externalName" as 'Read Only".

    2) grant this role to = Everyone

    3) restrict target popultion to: f1=v1

2. Navigate to Search Data page, click Search again. Verify only Root1 has a record displayed. No Root2 record.

3. Click the link for Root1 and verify Edit link displayed.

4. Click Edit link, verify externalName is Read Only. Update externalCode from Root1 to Root1_Updated.

5. Click Search again and verify externalCode for Root1 record is get updated as above step.

testcase.name: History record is in hierarchy but future record is not, update asOfDate to verify user's permission
testcase.preconditions:
1. Go to provisioning, choose test company instance, uncheck 'Enable Position Management', uncheck 'True position hierarchy', and check 'Succession management'.

2. Set Secured for Position as No and create some hierarchy position data as below:

Parent: effective date=Jan/01/2017 (less than today), incumbent is Admin User (logged-in user in this case).

Parent_nonAdmin: effective date=Jan/01/2017 (less than today), incumbent is non-Admin User.

Child: has two records

  1. effective date=Jan/01/2017 (less than today), its Higher-Level Position is Parent

  2. effective date=Jan/01/2020 (greater than today), its Higher-Level Position is Parent_nonAdmin

step.actions: Go to Configure Object Definition page, choose Position and set Secured as Yes, set Permission Category as Miscellaneous Permissions. Leave Create respects target criteria as No. Then save.

Go to Manage Permission Roles, create a new role. In 2 permission settings section, click Permission button. In left section, click Miscellaneous Permissions. Then go to right side, find out Position and check all access. Then click Done.

Go to section '3 Grant this role to', click Add button.
In opened page, select Everyone (All employees) in section '1: Define whom you want to grant this role permission to.'

In section '2: Specify the target population for the other objects', select 'Restrict target population to:'

Check the checkbox 'Include access to Position in the hierarchy below the Granted User's Position'. Set to 1 level down, and uncheck 'Exclude access to Granted User's Position'. Then click Done button.

Click Save Changes button on role page.

Go to Manage Data page. Select Position in Search field.

Click instance dropdown list arrow, and verify the returned instances.
step.expectedresults: Parent and Child should be returned.

step.actions:
Select 'Child' in instance list.

Verify left history panel.
step.expectedresults:
For time Jan/01/2017：

1. User should be able to view it.

2. User should be able to edit it.

3. User should be able to insert a new record.

For time Jan/01/2020:

'No permission' should be shown on left panel.

step.actions:
Click Advanced link and change 'as of date' to Jan/01/2020.

Verify instance list.
step.expectedresults: Child should not be returned.

testcase.name: one-level hierarchy position works in target population
testcase.summary: http://jira.successfactors.com/browse/XAF-2352
testcase.preconditions:
1.Make sure there is definition named:position in generic object definition

2.Go to manage data page to create basic type positions with the hierarchy: position1; position2_1 and position2_2 with parent position:position1;position3 with parent position:position2_1;position4 with position3;position5 with position4.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2000

3.Create an another hierarchy:position6,position7 with parent position6,position8 with parent position7.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2010

step.actions:
• create a permission role:Level_one
  • Add view current permission to all the positions
  • Grant role to everyone
  • In the position hierarchy option chart, choose position.code=position1 and levels down=1
go to manage data to check
step.expectedresults: only position1 and position2_1 and position2_2 of 01/01/2010 can be viewed but aren't editable

step.actions:
• Change the position.code=position3 and levels down=1
  • go to manage data page to check
step.expectedresults: only position3 and position4 in record 01/01/2010 can be viewed but aren't editable

step.actions: Change the permission role adding view history permission to do the upper testing again
step.expectedresults: the target position of both records can be viewed.

step.actions: Grant the role to cgrant to do the upper testing again
step.expectedresults: only cgrant has the upper permission

testcase.name: two-level hierarchy position works in target population
testcase.preconditions:
1.Make sure there is definition named:position in generic object definition

2.Go to manage data page to create basic type positions with the hierarchy: position1; position2_1 and position2_2 with parent position:position1;position3 with parent position:position2_1;position4 with position3;position5 with position4.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2000

3.Create an another hierarchy:position6,position7 with parent position6,position8 with parent position7.

set the effective start date as 01/01/2010

step.actions:
• Create a permission role: Two_Level
  • Add view permission to all the positions
  • Grant role to everyone
  • In the position hierarchy option chart, choose position.code=position1 and levels down=2

• Create another permission role: Two_Level_2
  • Add delete permission to all the positions,grant role to everyone
  • In the position hierarchy option chart, choose position.code=position6 and levels down=1
go to manage data to check
step.expectedresults: only position4,position5,position8 cannot be viewed, others can be viewed and deleted but aren't editable

step.actions: Change the permission role adding edit permission to Two_Level_2 to do the upper testing
step.expectedresults: the target position will have the edit permission.

step.actions: Grant the role to cgrant to do the testing
step.expectedresults: only cgrant have the permission of the target position.

testcase.preconditions:

  • Basic Type 'BasicEntity'
  • cust_user= user type
  • RBP subject user = cust_user

Role1:

  • check view and insert permission
  • set general period = 12 months, TP = user1

create object:
object1, user1, 11/1/2016

object1, user1, 12/1/2016

object1, user2, 12/1/2017

step.actions:
AT1 Given records in or out of AP, only records in AP will show in manage data portlet.
Given

Definition1:

  • Basic Type 'BasicEntity'
  • cust_user= user type
  • RBP subject user = cust_user

Role1:

  • check view and insert permission
  • set general period = 12 months, TP = user1

create object:

When

View the go instance on manage data page
Then

One record will load:

object1, user1, 6 months ago

And no strike-through on details window

testcase.name: Sync permission role with multi-type TC with inactive role
testcase.summary: Sync permission role with multi-type TC with inactive role
testcase.preconditions:
1. create simple object definition cust_go and instance object1 in both source instance and target instance.

2. create object definition cust_god in both source and target instance with:

    a: String type externalCode

    b. String type cust_stringField

    c. GO type cust_goField, valid values souce = cust_go

    d. FO type cust_foField, valid values souce = Location

    e. set RBP secured = Yes

3. create permission roleA in source instance:

    a. all permission for cust_god

    b. field_override: stringField = readOnly

    c. grant to everyone

    d. TC: (1) goField = object1; (2) foField = Shanghai

    e. save

4. add rule for roleA in source instance:

    a. grant tp everyone

    b. TC: (1) stringField = string1

    c. save

    d. set the rule inactive

step.actions: 1. Sync permission roleA to target instance
2. Verify permission roleA in target instance are same as the roles in source instance

testcase.name: Sync permission role - update role in target instance
testcase.summary: Sync permission role - update role in target instance
testcase.preconditions:
1. create object definition cust_god in both source and target instance with:

    a: String type externalCode

    b. String type cust_stringField

    c. set RBP secured = Yes

2. create permission roleA in source instance:

    a. all permission for cust_god

    b. field_override: stringField = readOnly

    c. grant to everyone

    d. TC:  stringField = string1

    e. save

3. create permission roleA in target instance:

    a. all permission for cust_god

    b. grant to everyone

    c. TC:  stringField = string2

    d. save

step.actions: 1. Sync permission role : roleA to target instance, check overwrite the existing Permission Roles in target instance
2. Verify permission role : RoleA in target instance is updated and same as RoleA in source instance

testcase.name: Sync permission role - rollback original role when sync job failed
testcase.summary: Sync permission role - rollback original role when sync job failed
testcase.preconditions:
1. create object defination cust_go in both source and target instance.

2. create object instance objectA for cust_go in source instance.

2. create object definition cust_god in both source and target instance with:

    a: String type externalCode

    b. String type cust_stringField

    c. GO type cust_goField, valid values source = cust_go

    d. set RBP secured = Yes

2. create permission roleA in source instance:

    a. all permission for cust_god

    b. grant to everyone

    c. TC: (1) stringField = string1 (2) goField = objectA

    d. save

3. create permission roleA in target instance:

    a. only view permission for cust_god

    b. field_override: stringField = readOnly

    c. grant to cgrant

    d. TC: (1) stringField = string2

    e. save

step.actions: Sync permission roleA to target instance and check overwrite the existing Permission Role in target instance
Verify sync job is failed and nothing of role in target instance is changed.
